qa_2020.evidence: Former President Obama made the speech from Philadelphia, a symbolic gesture as it is the city where the Declaration of Independence and United States Constitution were both drafted and ratified.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Widespread wildfires caused which US state to have the worst air quality on the planet?
qa_2020.evidence: Over 25 major fire incidents spanning hundreds of thousands of acres across California left the state with the worst air quality in the world, with experts putting it in the “very unhealthy” and “hazardous” range. Satellite images showed plumes of smoke extending more than 600 miles into the Pacific Ocean.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Local officials made the final approval to release 750 million specimens of what genetically modified critter in the Florida Keys?
qa_2020.evidence: Local officials, after approval from the state and Environmental Protection Agency, are moving forward with plans to release 750 million genetically modified mosquitoes in the Florida Keys in 2021 and 2022. Authorities hope the program would be a viable alternative to insecticides currently used against mosquitoes harboring diseases such as Zika, dengue, chikungunya and yellow fever. Critics view it as a short-sighted experiment, especially during a pandemic.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which cabinet minister apologised on behalf of successive UK governments to members of the Windrush generation after an independent report concluded that the scandal was “foreseeable and preventable”?
The Queen has released a message to the nation on the coronavirus outbreak as she and Prince Philip enter isolation where?
The Bank of England has cut interest rates to what historic low?
Which banned art form is set to be made legal in the UK, according to government sources?
English football will remain suspended until at least 30 April as a result of the coronavirus outbreak, the FA has announced, with the current football season extended until when?
Coronavirus fears have triggered the cancellation of which festival that was due to celebrate its 50th anniversary with headline performances by Taylor Swift, Paul McCartney and Kendrick Lamar?
Which online platform is reducing its streaming quality in Europe for the next 30 days to ease pressure on internet service providers as more people work from home?
A former beauty pageant contestant convicted of membership of banned extreme right-wing group National Action at Birmingham Crown Court this week had entered which contest?
Research based on data from the World Happiness Index has found that Londoners are happiest when they are…
Who is the new Islamic State leader?
Which country topped a Gallup poll of the “most admired” countries in the world?
Which tech billionaire had an awkward moment during a Congressional hearing when he had to be told he was “on mute” while trying to speak?
The mystery of where the Stonehenge stones came from was solved this week, but what was the answer?
Who this week advised Boris Johnson to “cull the cabinet” to end government rivalries?
The president of which country has advised people to douse their face masks in petrol to fend off coronavirus?
According to the Office for Budget Responsibility, how much is the coronavirus crisis going to cost the UK economy?
Uruguay has been praised for bucking South American trends by successfully combating the coronavirus, but how many infections has it had?
Meghan Markle is to pay out how much money after losing the first round of her legal battle with the Mail on Sunday?
American’s have been warned to report unsolicited packages from China containing what?
What percentage of coronavirus tests are thought to return false positive results?
A court ruled that victims of “black rain” are entitled to receive medical benefits. This essentially designated them as official survivors of what world-changing event?
qa_2020.evidence: Previously considered too far from the blast zone, a Japanese court found that dozens of victims who experienced radioactive “black rain” during the Hiroshima atomic bombing were finally eligible for medical benefits. This comes just days before the 75th anniversary of the attack.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which country reported its first suspected coronavirus case this week?
qa_2020.evidence: According to state-run newswire KCNA, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un convened an emergency meeting after a reported defector returned to the country possibly infected with coronavirus. This would mark the first reported case in the country.

qa_2020.question_sentence: CEOs from some of the world’s most powerful tech companies were questioned as part of a Congressional hearing. What was the hearing focused on?
qa_2020.evidence: The CEOs from Apple, Google, Facebook and Amazon were questioned as part of a high-profile Congressional hearing looking into antitrust violations and competitive tactics in the online marketplace.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Mysterious unsolicited packages found their way to mailboxes around the United States. What do these packages contain?
qa_2020.evidence: All 50 states have issued a warning to be on the lookout for mysterious packages containing seeds. The packages appear to be from China and possibly part of an elaborate “brushing scam” where third-party sellers send people unsolicited items and write fake online reviews on their behalf.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which country says it’s on track to have a coronavirus vaccine ready for public use by mid-August, despite no proof of effectiveness and safety?
qa_2020.evidence: Russia hasn’t completed the second phase of coronavirus vaccine trials, but still says its vaccine will be safe for public use by mid-August, with frontline healthcare workers receiving the first doses.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which American celebrity posted on social media this week about donating plasma after contracting coronavirus?
qa_2020.evidence: Bryan Cranston posted on Instagram that he had been one of the “lucky ones” who faced only minor symptoms after contracting the virus. He encouraged his fans to keep wearing masks, washing hands and staying socially distant.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which former US presidential candidate died of the coronavirus this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Herman Cain — a one-time Republican presidential candidate, co-chair of Black Voices for Trump and former CEO of Godfather’s Pizza – died of Covid-19 at the age of 74.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The US announced it will withdraw 12,000 troops from which European nation?
qa_2020.evidence: The Pentagon is moving forward with plans to withdraw 12,000 US troops from Germany. The move, announced by Secretary of Defense Mark Esper, met bipartisan condemnation, with many viewing it as a direct blow to NATO.

qa_2020.question_sentence: More than a dozen players on various MLB teams have tested positive for the coronavirus, causing several delays and postponements in the newly-revived baseball season. Which of the teams below has had team members test positive for the virus?
qa_2020.evidence: The Phillies, Cardinals and Marlins are among the latest Major League Baseball teams with members who have tested positive for Covid-19. This comes at the start of an already-postponed season and it has sparked concern among teams that have recently come in contact with them.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Topo Chico, a cult-favorite sparkling water brand, will soon have a line of hard seltzer. What is Topo Chico’s well-known parent company?
qa_2020.evidence: The Coca-Cola Company is launching a hard seltzer line under Topo Chico, a brand it acquired in 2017. The drink will initially be available in select Latin American cities.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Who has imposed coronavirus lockdown measures in Rio de Janeiro’s favelas in the absence of action by the Brazilian government?
In which country did more than half a million people take part in a virtual political protest last weekend?
How many viewers tuned in to watch Boris Johnson announce a complete lockdown of the UK?
Where in his home did an Italian man run back and forth for 26.2 miles to replicate a marathon?
What is the name of the worm-like creature found in fossil deposits in Australia that experts believe may be the “ancestor of all animal life”?
In a breakthrough for conservationists, the number of which African animal was reported this week to have risen from 4,845 to 5,630 in just six years?
Which TV personality this week appeared to accidentally reveal that they rent out thousands of acres of their land to fracking companies?
Britons being invited to help out the Met Office and stay occupied during the lockdown by doing what?
choices: Count the snow days in the past decade

qa_2020.question_sentence: What do conspiracy theorists claim is exacerbating the coronavirus pandemic?
Scotland's former first minister Alex Salmond was found not guilty this week of how many sexual assault charges?
Which restaurant chain announced it wasn't going to pay April rent in any of its hundreds of locations?
qa_2020.evidence: In a letter to the company's landlords, CEO David Overton wrote that the "severe decrease in restaurant traffic has severely decreased our cash flow and inflicted a tremendous financial blow to our business."

qa_2020.question_sentence: More than 100 employees at hospitals in which major American city have tested positive for coronavirus?
qa_2020.evidence: That news comes amidst fears that hospitals will run short on staff as workers contract the virus from ill patients.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which brand is donating its shoes to health care workers fightng coronavirus?
qa_2020.evidence: Crocs is delivering some shipments straight to hospitals and other facilities, but it's also allowing workers to sign up for the free shoes online.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The date for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics was changed this week. When will the Games now take place?
qa_2020.evidence: The International Olympic Committee and Japanese officials decided the games "must be rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021, to safeguard the health of the athletes, everybody involved in the Olympic Games and the international community."

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which state official said he would risk catching coronavirus and sacrifice his health to go out and help boost the economy?
qa_2020.evidence: Speaking to Fox News, Patrick, who soon turns 70, said "No one reached out to me and said, 'As a senior citizen, are you willing to take a chance on your survival in exchange for keeping the America that all America loves for your children and grandchildren?' And if that is the exchange, I'm all in."

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which Washington, D.C. landmark donated 5,000 respirator masks to hospitals after finding them in it's crypt level?
qa_2020.evidence: The masks were originally bought more than a decade ago when Americans were concerned about the bird flu.

qa_2020.question_sentence: As the coronavirus pandemic continues, brands across the country are revamping their logos to promote what practice?
qa_2020.evidence: McDonald's, Coca-Cola, Audi and Volkswagen are just a few of the corporate conglomerates that are interpreting "social distancing" with logo redesigns.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A 5.0 magnitude earthquake occurred in which state this week?
qa_2020.evidence: The earthquake, which occurred on Thursday morning, affected a sparsely populated area some 26 miles west of the small town of Mentone.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, is set to voice a Disney documentary about which African animal?
qa_2020.evidence: Titled simply "Elephants," the new doc will start streaming on April 3 on Disney+ along with a documentary about dolphins narrated by actress Natalie Portman. "Elephant" tells the story of African elephant Shani and her son Jomo as they journey across the Kalahari Desert with their herd.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This country pardoned more than 4,000 prisoners to help prevent coronavirus spread.
qa_2020.evidence: Sahle-Work Zewde announced the order in a tweet on Wednesday and said it would help prevent overcrowding in prisons. The directive only covers those given a maximum sentence of three years for minor crimes and those who were about to be released from jail, she said. There are currently 12 confirmed cases of Covid-19 in Ethiopia, according to the World Health Organization on Wednesday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Hungary and Poland have angered European Union members by vetoing a Covid recovery package worth how much in funding?
What percentage of hospitality and pub businesses have industry lobbyists predicted will close in 2021?
How much funding has the government pledged to help major spectator sports in the UK survive the winter?
In the wake of his election loss to Joe Biden, Donald Trump asked senior advisers to lay out the “options” for enacting which of the following plans?
choices: Rebuilding the US-Mexico border wall from scratch
Removing California from the electoral college
Fleeing the country after inauguration day

qa_2020.question_sentence: China circumvented a no-live-shots agreement during a border stand-off with India by deploying what unusual weapon?
Researchers studying Covid-19 antibodies in blood samples have suggested that the virus may have arrived in Italy during which month?
Cars and vans powered entirely by petrol and diesel will be banned from sale in the UK from which year under Boris Johnson’s new ten-point environmental plan?
Which airline has revealed that its passenger numbers fell by 50% year-on-year in 2020?
A study has revealed that what percentage of coronavirus patients are diagnosed with a psychiatric disorder or mental health issue within three months of being infected?
The London-based Design Museum has sparked controversy with its hypothetical creation of “DIY meal kits” for growing steaks from which animal?
The Government’s rescue deal for Flybe lets the ailing airline defer payment of a tax bill said to total how much?
Which artist has been chosen to record the title track for upcoming James Bond film No Time To Die?
According to new research, how did phosphorus, a key chemical component of all life on Earth, first arrive on our planet?
choices: Carried on comets from newborn stars

qa_2020.question_sentence: Democratic primary hopefuls Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren have locked horns over claims that who said what?
choices: Warren said Sanders is rubbish at basketball
Sanders said a woman couldn’t win the presidency
Sanders said that he agrees with Donald Trump’s “America first” vision
Warren said the military intervention in Iran was a good idea

qa_2020.question_sentence: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa is looking for a partner to fly to the Moon with him on board which company’s rocket?
Which author came under fire for tweeting that diversity shouldn’t play a role in Oscar nominations?
How many pages long is the UK’s immigration rulebook?
Who features on a coin that has sold for a UK record-breaking £1m?
A Mexican man was hospitalised recently after taking viagra meant for bulls - but how long did the “effects” last?
What long-standing Tory pledge has the Government hinted could be scrapped?
choices: The four-hour waiting time target in A&E

qa_2020.question_sentence: The entire government of this country resigned this week, including the Prime Minister, after the President suggested making changes to the country’s constitution.
qa_2020.evidence: Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev and the entire Russian cabinet resigned after President Vladimir Putin proposed sweeping reforms that could help him hold onto power after his presidential term is up.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Democratic presidential candidates Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders sparred after Warren claimed Sanders made what kind of controversial comment?
choices: That a woman couldn’t win the Presidency
That he was the only qualified candidate
That no Democrat could beat President Trump
That Hillary Clinton deserved to lose in 2016
qa_2020.evidence: Warren claims Sanders told her privately that he didn't believe a female candidate could win the presidential race. Sanders has roundly denied he said such a thing.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which team won the College Football Playoff National Championship?
qa_2020.evidence: The LSU Tigers beat the Clemson Tigers to secure their first championship in the college football playoff era.

qa_2020.question_sentence: President Trump signed a new trade deal with China that the administration hopes will help what group of workers affected by the economic tensions between the two countries?
qa_2020.evidence: As part of the deal, Beijing has pledged to double its purchases from American farmers.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Fans of this rock band are furious that they were not included in the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame’s list of 2020 inductees
qa_2020.evidence: DMB fans wanted to know why the band was snubbed even though they pulled in more than 1 million fan votes.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The House finally handed the impeachment articles over to the Senate, which means the impeachment trial of President Trump will soon officially be underway. Who will preside over the trial?
choices: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi
Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts
qa_2020.evidence: Supreme Court Chief Justice was sworn in days before the trial and will oversee the proceedings.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Though the conversation about last week’s downing of Ukrainian International Airlines Flight 752 has mostly focused on the United States, Ukraine and the US, this country is also mourning after losing 63 citizens in the crash.
qa_2020.evidence: Sixty-three Canadians were on board the flight. Many of these were Iranian Canadians traveling to Canada via the Ukraine.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The White House is considering diverting $7.2 billion in Pentagon funding to bolster what controversial project?
choices: A new military base in the Middle East
qa_2020.evidence: The $7.2 billion would go toward completing about 885 miles of new fencing at the southern border in the next few years.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The World Health Organization released a list of urgent health challenges the world is likely to face in the coming decade. What was one of the top challenges it highlighted?
qa_2020.evidence: Climate change as a health problem was one of the top items on the WHO’s list. The effects of climate change could include more air pollution, dangerous weather patterns and other factors that could increase disease and injury.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The New York Public Library revealed its most checked-out book of all time. What is it?
qa_2020.evidence: “The Snowy Day,” by Ezra Jack Keats, topped the list. (The other options for this answer were also among the NYPL’s most checked-out selections.)

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which former Australian prime minister has been linked to a senior post-Brexit trade role in the UK?
Germany appointed intelligence expert Arndt Freytag von Loringhoven as ambassador to Poland earlier in the summer, but why has Warsaw refused to formalise his role?
choices: He was previously ambassador to Russia
He has made comments attacking Polish citizens
His father took part in the Nazi invasion of Poland

qa_2020.question_sentence: “Stressed-out” elephants at a zoo in Poland are to be given which drug as part of a trial to reduce anxiety?
What percentage of furloughed workers continued working illegally during their time away from work?
The British Army is considering scrapping its range of which vehicle in a push to cut costs and prioritise cyberwarfare?
While serving as Labour leader, Jeremy Corbyn got his stance on which controversial issue “wrong”, according to former adviser Andrew Murray?
Which supermarket chain has announced plans to create 16,000 permanent jobs following its “exceptional growth” during lockdown?
Two of the so-called “Isis Beatles” could be convicted and sentenced to life in an infamous US supermax security prison in which state?
How many NHS patients in need of follow-up appointments are thought to be trapped on a “hidden” waiting list due to coronavirus?
At the Republican convention this week, Donald Trump repeated the claim that his Democrat rival Joe Biden wants to “abolish” what?
Which high-profile convicted murderer’s death sentence was overturned by California’s Supreme Court?
qa_2020.evidence: Scott Peterson was convicted of murder and sentenced to death for the 2002 deaths of his wife, Laci, and unborn son. The sentence was called into question after an appeals court found that potential jurors at the time were dismissed erroneously over their views on the death penalty. Despite the reversal in the death sentence, his murder convictions stand.

qa_2020.question_sentence: US President Donald Trump was nominated as the official Republican presidential candidate during the Republican National Convention. Where did he give his final speech?
qa_2020.evidence: Trump delivered his final RNC speech at the White House after a series of days at other locations. These speeches are traditionally held in large, packed arenas, but because of the coronavirus pandemic, changes were made to the convention’s schedule.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which well-known fast-food restaurant has decided to pause the use of its 64-year-old slogan because it “doesn’t feel quite right” during the pandemic?
qa_2020.evidence: As official coronavirus guidance encourages people to wash hands and avoid face-touching, KFC announced in a statement it’s going to pause the use of their slogan “finger lickin’ good.” “We find ourselves in a unique situation — having an iconic slogan that doesn’t quite fit in the current environment,” said Catherine Tan-Gillespie, global chief marketing officer at KFC. The menu will remain unchanged.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Before Hurricane Laura made landfall in Louisiana this week, officials warned that what specifically might be “unsurvivable”?
qa_2020.evidence: The National Hurricane Center warned that Hurricane Laura could bring “unsurvivable” storm surge to much of the Gulf Coast and could even “penetrate up to 30 miles inland from the immediate coastline.”  The storm pummeled Louisiana and far eastern Texas as it made landfall as a Category 4 storm with sustained winds of 150 mph.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The World Health Health Organization announced that Africa saw the eradication of which highly infectious disease?
qa_2020.evidence: The WHO announced that polio has finally been eradicated from the continent of Africa, a mission that’s been ongoing since 1996 with world partners through the Global Polio Eradication Initiative. Since then, nearly 9 billion polio vaccines have been delivered to Africa, which WHO says have prevented nearly 1.8 million children from infection and saved around 180,000 lives.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Spurring action within the NBA and across the sporting world, which team decided to boycott their playoff game against the Orlando Magic in protest of the police shooting of Jacob Blake?
qa_2020.evidence: The Milwaukee Bucks decided to boycott their playoff game against the Orlando Magic in protest of the police shooting of Jacob Blake, a Black man in Kenosha, Wisconsin. In solidarity, the NBA decided it would postpone Game 5 of three different playoff series. Games from other leagues, such as Major League Baseball, Major League Soccer and the WNBA, were also called off in support.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Brenton Tarrant was sentenced to life in prison without the opportunity for parole for the killing of 51 people at two mosques in 2019, the first sentence of its kind in which country?
qa_2020.evidence: Australian citizen Brenton Tarrant, 29, was tried and sentenced in New Zealand. The mosque attacks in Christchurch were the country’s worst mass shooting in modern history.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Multiple US troops were injured in Syria after a collision with forces from which country?
qa_2020.evidence: According to US officials, multiple US troops were injured after a Russian military convoy collided with an American vehicle. The Pentagon eventually responded to the incident, saying it was “deliberately provocative and aggressive behavior.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: Major backlash occurred after the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention changed its website recommendations on what coronavirus-specific guidelines?
qa_2020.evidence: The CDC suddenly changed its guidance on Covid-19 testing, suggesting that those knowingly exposed to someone with coronavirus do not necessarily need to get tested if they remain asymptomatic and aren’t part of an at-risk group. Previously, the CDC recommended getting tested after known exposure, regardless of being symptomatic.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Crew from the US Coast Guard Cutter Kimball had an unexpected encounter with what sea creature when attempting an open-ocean swim?
qa_2020.evidence: Over 30 crew members from US Coast Guard Cutter Kimball had a close encounter with a shark, causing the swimmers to quickly exit the water and other crew to fire shots at the animal in defense. Nobody was injured in the incident and the shark left the area seemingly unscathed.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the name of the Tory party donor and pharma boss who has been banned from managing any UK company for “ripping off the NHS” by forcing up drug prices?
Approximately how many potential coronavirus vaccines are currently being tested worldwide?
The coronavirus outbreak in the Chinese city of Wuhan may have begun as early as late summer or autumn last year, according to a new analysis of what?
Which children’s author has stirred up controversy with a series of tweets labelled “transphobic” by critics?
A man reportedly had to have what animal surgically removed from his rectum after telling a sceptical nurse that he “accidentally sat on” it?
Russia is battling to contain a spill of how many tonnes of diesel oil in the Arctic Circle?
An ex-government adviser this week claimed that entering lockdown a week earlier could have reduced the UK’s Covid-19 death toll by how much?
Which is the only UK university to have climbed to a higher ranking in the top 20 of the latest international league table for higher education?
By what percentage have property sales in England rebounded since the market was “unfrozen” last month?
NHS bosses have warned that waiting lists are likely to rise to what figure by Christmas as a result of a coronavirus-related backlog of cases?
Tropical Depression Cristobal, the third named storm of the season (and earliest third named Atlantic storm on record), made landfall in which US state?
qa_2020.evidence: The storm threatened Louisiana Sunday with flooding and storm surges after making landfall between the mouth of the Mississippi River and Grand Isle.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Republican National Convention was supposed to take place entirely in Charlotte, North Carolina, but Trump wanted it moved over the state’s coronavirus restrictions. Where will key parts of it now be taking place?
qa_2020.evidence: Republican National Committee Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel announced on Thursday that the President will accept the Republican nomination in Jacksonville, calling Florida Trump’s “home state.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: A Banksy mural painted on the fire door of Paris’s Bataclan theater was stolen last year. The artwork has since turned up hundreds of miles away in which European country?
qa_2020.evidence: Two sources with the Carabinieri paramilitary police force of the central Italian region of Abruzzo told CNN on Wednesday that one of their units found the painting in the province of Teramo.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which major sports league banned the Confederate flag from its events?
qa_2020.evidence: NASCAR said in a statement that showcasing the flag “runs contrary to our commitment to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment for all fans, our competitors and our industry.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: Rev. Al Sharpton said in a eulogy this week that “God took the rejected stone and made him the cornerstone of a movement that’s going to change the whole wide world.” Who was Sharpton referring to?
qa_2020.evidence: Sharpton was one of a number of family, friends and prominent figures who gathered at The Fountain of Praise Church in Houston on Tuesday to celebrate Floyd’s life and issue a clarion call for justice.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which talk show host filed for divorce, citing “irreconcilable differences”?
qa_2020.evidence: Clarkson filed for divorce from husband Brandon Blackstock, requesting joint legal and physical custody of the children.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A new federal rule will make it easier to hunt bears and wolves on national preserves in which state?
qa_2020.evidence: The Trump administration published a new rule, going into effect next month, overturning an Obama-era ban on controversial hunting and trapping techniques on national preserves in Alaska.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Statues of what famous explorer are being increasingly removed across the country?
qa_2020.evidence: There have been numerous reports of Christopher Columbus statues being torn down or destroyed – one thrown into a lake, one beheaded and another pulled to the ground.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Two NFL stars have called on their alma mater to sever ties with John C. Calhoun, who advocated for slavery. What school did they attend?
choices: University of California at Los Angeles
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
qa_2020.evidence: Deshaun Watson, DeAndre Hopkins and thousands others called on Clemson University to rename some of its facilities, notably the Honors College program, that bear the name of slaveholder John C. Calhoun. On Friday, the school’s trustees voted to do just that.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which well-known author wrote a controversial essay arguing that transgender women should not be allowed in single-sex spaces?
qa_2020.evidence: In the 3,600-word piece, published on Wednesday, Rowling explained why she has joined the UK’s polarizing trans debate, revealing that she was “a domestic abuse and sexual assault survivor” and held “concerns around single sex spaces.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: Senate confirmation hearings kicked off to replace the late Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s seat on the Supreme Court. Which federal judge is currently being considered by the Senate?
qa_2020.evidence: Senate Judiciary Committee hearings began to vet federal Judge Amy Coney Barrett as Justice Ginsburg’s replacement. The vote on her confirmation has been set for October 22, less than two weeks before Election Day.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which country disbanded a controversial police unit called the Special Anti-Robbery Squad, also referred to as “SARS”?
qa_2020.evidence: Nigeria disbanded SARS following nationwide protests and weeks of outcry alleging systemic kidnapping, harassment, torture, sexual violence and extortion by the unit.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which team won the NBA championship this week, its first title since 2010?
qa_2020.evidence: The Los Angeles Lakers beat the Miami Heat 106-93, marking 10 years since the team last appeared in the NBA Finals — when Kobe Bryant led them to victory. Bryant has been mourned the world over since his death in a helicopter crash in January.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Amazon’s “Prime Day” sale was this week. Which rival company held its own “Big Save” event?
qa_2020.evidence: Walmart launched its online “Big Save” sale in direct competition with Amazon’s Prime Day. Retailers like Target, BJ’s Wholesale Club and Best Buy also have gotten in the game with their respective days of savings.

qa_2020.question_sentence: American fast-food company Dunkin’ is adding what type of donut to its menu for the first time ever?
qa_2020.evidence: Dunkin’ has added a spicy donut to its repertoire, called the “Spicy Ghost Pepper Donut.” Available through December, the unique treat will be topped with strawberry icing that contains a blend of cayenne and ghost pepper.

qa_2020.question_sentence: US Senator Elizabeth Warren harshly criticized which American company for handsomely compensating its top executives while “hanging its front-line workers out to dry”?
qa_2020.evidence: Senator Warren wrote a letter condemning Disney for prioritizing shareholders and executive pay packages over its workers, primarily centered around the company’s massive, years-long share buyback program. The letter comes after the company announced it was laying off 28,000 employees.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which European country announced it will impose nighttime, pandemic-related curfews in various cities in order to reduce what its president called “private contacts, which are the most dangerous contacts?”
qa_2020.evidence: With a significant uptick of coronavirus cases in France, President Emmanuel Macron announced the curfews. Violations will carry a fine of 135 euros (about $160) for a first offense and will significantly increase for repeat offenses.

qa_2020.question_sentence: During a town hall event, President Donald Trump failed to condemn the spread of which pervasive group of conspiracy theorists?
qa_2020.evidence: When pressed by moderator Savannah Guthrie, Trump refused to condemn QAnon, a far-right collective which spreads false claims alleging there’s a “deep state” alliance of Satan-worshiping politicians and celebrities who engage in child sex trafficking and are working to bring down the President.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What strange sight did pilots report in the skies near Los Angeles International Airport on Wednesday?
qa_2020.evidence: For the second time in recent months, pilots reported seeing a man in a jetpack flying over greater Los Angeles, less than 10 miles from LAX. According to the FAA, a China Airlines crew reported seeing the man at an altitude of 6,000 feet.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A new study featured in the journal Frontiers in Psychology found that which animals prefer to listen to people in person versus a recorded voice?
qa_2020.evidence: In a study looking at 28 heifers, Austrian researchers found that cows become more relaxed when hearing humans speak to them in person rather than over a loudspeaker or via a recording.

qa_2020.question_sentence: California wildfires have burned how many acres of land so far this year?
Which changes on the most recent update of Google Maps have provoked the ire of pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong?
choices: Border between China and Hong Kong has been redrawn
The city’s English place names have been removed
Anti-China graffiti has been blurred out in Street View
Protesters’ faces are visible on Street View

qa_2020.question_sentence: How much is the new “Covid-proof” city of Xiong’an being built in China expected to cost Beijing?
Japan’s Olympic minister insisted this week that the Tokyo Games will go ahead in 2021, but what was the theme of the cancelled 2020 event intended to be?
Uber has pledged to go fully electric by what year in a push to “aggressively tackle the challenge of climate change”?
WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange faces up to how many years in prison if his legal bid to block his extradition to the US fails?
Nintendo is releasing new games to celebrate which anniversary of the original release of Super Mario Bros?
UK police chiefs are backing proposed “cannabis cards” that would effectively decriminalise use of the drug for medicinal purposes for roughly how many people with medical conditions?
Which town is the “tax-dodging capital of England”, according to a new analysis of MHRC data?
Draft documents from the Department of Homeland Security view what as the most “persistent and lethal threat” to the United States through 2021?
qa_2020.evidence: Though continued Russian interference and foreign terrorism were listed as threats on DHS draft documents, white supremacy was at the top of the list. The three drafts differ in their wording overall, but each contain this language: “Among DVEs [Domestic Violent Extremists], we judge that white supremacist extremists (WSEs) will remain the most persistent and lethal threat in the Homeland through 2021.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: Ivan Kratsov and Anton Rodnenkov, both members of the Belarus Coordination Council, recounted their story of abduction in Belarus and escape to which country?
qa_2020.evidence: The two activists fled to Kiev, Ukraine, and told of their harrowing tale of abduction by Belarusian authorities and ultimate escape across the border. The men also spoke of the last sighting of Maria Kolesnikova, a prominent critic of the Belarusian president, and her subsequent detainment. This happened against the backdrop of weeks of major protests in Belarus.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Trade negotiations entered their eighth week between the European Union and which other country?
qa_2020.evidence: After formally completing its separation from the EU, the United Kingdom is now involved in post-Brexit trade negotiations with the 27-country bloc as part of commitments made between the two governments. Tensions are on the rise as reports have surfaced suggesting the UK is wanting to change various elements of its obligations, particularly as they relate to Northern Ireland.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which American company announced it’ll host a career day with the hopes to ultimately hire 33,000 new employees?
qa_2020.evidence: According to the company’s press release, Amazon will hold a Career Day on September 16 that will include a team of 1,000 recruiters and 20,000 free career coaching sessions. Employees filling corporate and tech roles will receive an average pay of $150,000.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A US entity, for the first time ever, released a report on the potentially dire economic consequences of climate change. Which entity released the report?
qa_2020.evidence: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission’s climate subcommittee report detailed the potential catastrophic consequences of climate change on the financial system and American economy, imploring Congress to act quickly to combat the crises. The report comes as states are reeling with record-setting wildfires down the west coast of the United States.

qa_2020.question_sentence: US President Donald Trump said he will not extend the sale deadline for which Chinese-owned company?
qa_2020.evidence: Donald Trump is threatening to ban Chinese company ByteDance’s TikTok app in the US unless an American company agrees to purchase it by September 20, a deadline he says he won’t extend. TikTok has come under criticism from administration officials who say the popular Chinese-owned app could pose risks to national security. The company itself rejects this idea and currently has lawsuits against the administration for its decision.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Recordings were released this week alleging that US President Trump intentionally played down the coronavirus threat to the public despite knowing of the severity of the virus. These recordings were part of which legendary journalist’s upcoming book?
qa_2020.evidence: Bob Woodward released the recordings in advance of his upcoming book “Rage.” The recordings portray President Trump understanding the serious threat posed by the coronavirus yet intentionally downplaying it to the American public, in one case saying it would simply “disappear.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: British actress Diana Rigg died this week at the age of 82. She’s most recently known for her role in what program?
qa_2020.evidence: Diana Rigg recently played the character of Lady Olenna Tyrell in “Game of Thrones.” Beloved by many with countless roles throughout the years, many view her most defining role as Emma Peel in the 1960s series “The Avengers”.

qa_2020.question_sentence: NASA is looking to buy what substance in order to encourage private-sector exploration of space?
qa_2020.evidence: NASA announced it’s looking to buy moon rocks and dust collected by private companies, all with the aim to encourage the commercialization of space exploration. NASA says bids are welcome from companies all over the world, must be verified as authentic and hope to complete the collection by 2024.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Friday marked the 19th anniversary of what major world-changing events?
choices: The fall of the Berlin Wall
The US led invasion of Afghanistan
qa_2020.evidence: Friday marked the 19th anniversary of the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center in New York City, Pentagon in Washington DC and outside of Shanksville, Pennsylvania. A total of 2,977 people were killed, making it the worst terrorist attack ever on American soil.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A record-breaking total of how many migrants crossed the Channel in small boats to reach British shores on Wednesday, according to Home Office data?
Which world leader has angered Russia by demanding answers from the Kremlin over the “attempted murder” of Vladimir Putin critic Alexei Navalny?
The shooting of unarmed black man Jacob Blake has sparked unrest in Kenosha, a city in which US state?

Dominic Cummings has kicked off his “overhaul” of the civil service by relocating 10 Downing Street’s top team to a new “control centre” in 70 Whitehall, which is the current home of which government department?
The BBC has reversed its decision to ban singing during the performance of Rule, Britannia! at The Last Night of the Proms, but who composed the music of the famous song?
A last-minute rush to take advantage of the Eat Out to Help Out scheme brought the total number of discounted meals sold to UK diners in August to how much?
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have signed a multimillion dollar deal to make documentaries, films and children’s shows with which media company?
Chancellor Rishi Sunak was reported this week to be considering hiking corporation tax from 19% to 24%, a move that experts estimated could raise how much next year?
People with which pre-existing condition account for a quarter of all Covid-related deaths in England and Wales, according to a new study?
Danish striker Pernille Harder is reported to have signed for Chelsea from Wolfsburg for a “record transfer fee for the women’s game” of how much?
The first Labor Day parade was held in what major city in 1882?
qa_2020.evidence: About 10,000 workers participated in the New York City parade on September 5th, 1882. That date is the reason Labor Day is always held on the first Monday of September.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Why did the workers who paved the way for Labor Day choose the month of September?
choices: It’s when children return to school
It was good weather for marches and strikes
It is halfway between Independence Day and Thanksgiving
It is the beginning of the fourth fiscal quarter of the year
qa_2020.evidence: Around the time the idea of Labor Day took hold, most union workers only got days off on Christmas, the 4th of July and some Sundays.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which president officially made Labor Day a national holiday?
qa_2020.evidence: Grover Cleveland made Labor Day a national holiday in 1894.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The creation of Labor Day didn’t mean fair labor laws were suddenly the norm. Which president passed laws that established the eight-hour workday and ended child labor?
qa_2020.evidence: In 1938, Roosevelt signed into law the Depression-era set of laws known as the The Fair Labor Standards Act.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The “other Labor Day,” as it is considered, is May Day, also known as International Workers’ Day. It is typically a time of protest and activism for workers around the world. What disastrous event does May Day commemorate?
choices: The Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire, an industrial disaster in New York City in 1911
The Battle of the Viaduct, a deadly clash between striking workers and federal troops in Chicago in 1877
The Haymarket Affair, a bombing during a peaceful worker’s rally in Chicago in 1886
The Thibodaux Massacre, in which townspeople murdered dozens -- and possibly hundreds -- of Black sugar cane workers striking for better conditions
qa_2020.evidence: International Workers’ Day commemorates the Haymarket Affair of 1886. However, the event was considered too controversial to serve as the basis for a national labor holiday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: About what share of working Americans are part of a labor union as of 2019?
qa_2020.evidence: About 10.3% of workers were part of a union in 2019, according to the US Bureau of Labor Statistics. In 1983, the union membership rate was 20.1%

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the largest single labor union in the US?
choices: National Education Association of the United States
qa_2020.evidence: The National Education Association of the United States has more than 3 million members, according to the Department of Labor. They include teachers but also bus drivers, librarians, cafeteria workers, school nurses and other positions.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Why do people always say you can’t wear white after Labor Day?
choices: White was a shade used by labor activists
It is the end of wedding season
Historically, heavier winter fabrics weren’t produced in white
No one knows, but it probably started with some rich people
qa_2020.evidence: It’s not clear how this outdated rule of fashion etiquette began, but experts point to the changing weather in fashion capitals and the fact that white was a popular shade of summer resort wear among the elites.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the name of the Black Lives Matter demonstrator pictured in a now-viral photo carrying a wounded white man out of harm’s way during protests in London?
African-American man Rayshard Brooks was fatally shot by a police officer at a Wendy’s drive-thru in which US city?
How many commemorative blue plaques in London has English Heritage pledged to review for possible links to the slave trade?
Scientists hope a decades-old vaccination against which of the following diseases may provide protection against a second wave of Covid-19?
How many school children will be eligible to get free meals during the summer holiday after a campaign led by footballer Marcus Rashford forced a government U-turn?
Which country this week announced that all of the data collected through its coronavirus contact-tracing app is to be deleted owing to privacy concerns?
Swiss authorities are searching for a mystery rail passenger who left gold bars worth a total of how much in a train carriage?
According to  former US security adviser John Bolton’s upcoming memoir, Donald Trump once asked if Finland was part of which country?
Which country is not a member of the trans-Pacific trade bloc that International Trade Secretary Liz Truss this week confirmed the UK hopes to join post-Brexit?
What percentage of a country’s GDP does the United Nations say should be spent on foreign aid?
Which country did US secretary of state Mike Pompeo urge to “come clean” over the coronavirus outbreak?
Which of these items did Cambridge University researchers suggest shoppers should take with them to avoid spreading coronavirus?
Which former Labour general secretary stepped down as a frontbencher in the House of Lords over the party’s leaked anti-semitism report?
Dominic Raab referred to a group called “Sage” in his Thursday briefing. What does it stand for?
choices: Services and Advocacy for General Emergencies

qa_2020.question_sentence: The IMF’s managing director said more than 100 countries have asked for emergency assistance due to coronavirus. What is the managing director’s name?
What unusual cake design has a Helsinki bakery introduced?
The 99-year old Captain Tom Moore has raised more than £18m for the NHS by walking 100 laps of his garden. Which regiment did he serve in in WW2?
ITV drama The Quiz shows the story of Charles and Diana Ingram cheating on which gameshow in 2003?
choices: Who Wants to be a Millionaire?

qa_2020.question_sentence: China reported that its GDP shrank in the first three months of 2020 – by how much?
The UK has used an EU-funded repatriation scheme to fly 1,000 Britons home. How many has Germany repatriated?
A farm in what state is giving away 2 million potatoes so they don’t go to waste?
qa_2020.evidence: Ryan Cranney, CEO of Cranney Farms, told CNN because of stay-at-home orders throughout the nation, the food service demand for potatoes is down significantly, leaving him with six months worth of crops.

qa_2020.question_sentence: About 90% of Americans are eligible for stimulus check payments, which began going out this week. How long will it take for everyone to get their check?
choices: Everyone has already received their payment.
qa_2020.evidence: The IRS began by sending money to the people it could reach the fastest, and will start processing paper checks next week. But the agency can only process roughly 5 million checks a week, so it could take months before all of them are sent out.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The World Health Organization is urging governments to limit consumption of what, following misinformation that it could protect against Covid-19?
qa_2020.evidence: "At times of lockdown during the COVID-19 pandemic, alcohol consumption can exacerbate health vulnerability, risk-taking behaviours, mental health issues and violence," WHO/Europe said in a factsheet published on Tuesday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Much like humans wear perfumes and colognes, these animals enhance their allure by releasing a fruity and floral scent in the form of a clear liquid from their wrists, according to new research.
qa_2020.evidence: "During the yearly breeding season, male lemurs rub the glands on their wrists against their fluffy tails and then wave them at females in a behavior called 'stink flirting,'" said University of Tokyo professor and biochemist Kazushige Touhara.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Apple unveiled its new iPhone SE this week. What makes this phone different?
qa_2020.evidence: The new version of the iPhone SE, which first launched in 2016, starts at just $399, far less than the entry-level iPhone 11, which costs $699.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Jalen Green, ranked as the No. 1 basketball recruit in the country by ESPN, is skipping the college route and instead doing what before enlisting in the NBA draft?
choices: Joining the National Basketball League in Australia/New Zealand.
qa_2020.evidence: There's no word yet on what team Green will be playing for. A news release from the G League said the team "will be unaffiliated with any existing NBA G League franchise or NBA team," but did not provide further details.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This musician released their fifth studio album this week, their first in almost eight years.
qa_2020.evidence: The album, called "Fetch the Bolt Cutters," is already being hailed by some critics as a potential album of the year.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This actor, known for their work on the show “The Office,” hosted a virtual prom this week for all the high schoolers who are missing out.
qa_2020.evidence: "The Office" star announced on his "Some Good News" YouTube show that he's going to be hosting a virtual prom on Friday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Protesters in multiple US states gathered at state capitals to protest what, prompting tweets from the President calling for liberation?
qa_2020.evidence: Michigan, Ohio, Kentucky, Minnesota, North Carolina and Utah have all seen protests in recent days as people grow more concerned about the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic.

qa_2020.question_sentence: According to the World Bank, this area of the world could suffer its first recession in 25 years because of the coronavirus.
qa_2020.evidence: The bank estimates "Covid-19 will cost the region between $37 billion and $79 billion in output losses for 2020 due to a combination of effects," including trade disruption and reduced remittances, tourism and foreign aid, according to a report released this week.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which former civil servant this week lodged an unfair dismissal complaint against the Home Office?
According to the World Economic Forum, how many countries have shut schools as a result of the coronavirus pandemic?
Court documents have revealed that Prince Harry texted who in a bid at reconciliation in the run-up to his 2018 wedding?
What is the term used to describe the average number of people that a person with a disease will go on to infect?
What did Tory MP Michael Fabricant jokingly threaten to wear during the first “virtual parliament” this week?
In which South American capital did police this week fire tear gas at citizens attempting to leave during lockdown?
Deaths in England and Wales are at a 20-year high after increasing to levels how much above what would be expected, according to the Office for National Statistics?
A newly published study by researchers in Paris suggest that which of the following may help ward of the Covid-19 coronavirus?
choices: Sleeping for ten hours a night

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which world leader has been rumoured to be seriously ill following secret heart surgery?
Which country is the best in the world for press freedom, according to the annual World Press Freedom Index?
A new survey has found that what fraction of Britons believe in QAnon-linked conspiracy theories?
Which social media giant rolled out a dating feature on their popular platform this week?
What has BBC chair Sir David Clementi said plays a role in whether people think the broadcaster is too left- or right-wing?
New studies from the WHO, Germany and Norway have ruled out a link between rising Covid-19 infection rates and the reopening of what?
A face mask perfumed with what scent has made headlines for offering wearers a ‘heavenly’ experience?
Which town has topped a new index of the best places in the UK to work from home?
US televangelist Pat Robertson this week claimed that God has told him Donald Trump will win the upcoming presidential election but will then face what?
choices: A new global pandemic worse than Covid-19

qa_2020.question_sentence: What did Michael Gove compare Brexit to during a ‘disastrous’ conference call with UK industry chiefs on Tuesday?
A motion tabled by Keir Starmer demanding a ‘fair one nation deal’ for communities facing Tier 3 coronavirus restrictions was defeated by how many votes on Wednesday?
Which telecoms company is partnering with Nasa to establish the first 4G network on the Moon?
Hiker Holly Courtier was found alive after going missing for two weeks in which national park?
qa_2020.evidence: Courtier was found alive in Zion National Park. Search and rescue teams located her after receiving a tip from a park visitor who said they had seen Courtier within the park.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which conservative radio talk show host announced that they have terminal lung cancer?
qa_2020.evidence: Rush Limbaugh announced that his stage 4 lung cancer has intensified, adding that “it’s not dramatic, but it is the wrong direction.” Limbaugh’s diagnosis came in February of this year.

qa_2020.question_sentence: NASA’s OSIRIS-REx spacecraft successfully gathered samples from Bennu. What is Bennu?
choices: An interplanetary region of gas cloud
qa_2020.evidence: Bennu is an asteroid. The OSIRIS-REx spacecraft had been orbiting the near-Earth object for nearly two years before successfully making brief contact to collect the samples. The samples are on track to arrive on Earth in 2023.

qa_2020.question_sentence: In a 4-4 decision, the Supreme Court has granted the state of Pennsylvania to do what as it pertains to the General Election?
choices: Enforce displaying IDs at the polls
Allow mail-in ballots to be counted after Election Day
Permit voter registration up to Election Day
qa_2020.evidence: The Supreme Court, with Chief Justice John Roberts as the swing vote, is allowing Pennsylvania to count mail-in votes so long as they’re received within three days of Election Day, a major blow to Republicans pushing to reject post-Election Day ballots.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Justice Department announced it is launching one of the largest antitrust cases against which American tech company?
qa_2020.evidence: Though Apple is implicated in the lawsuit, the department is suing Google alleging that it has totally cornered the “search” market and stifles competition because of its various business dealings. It will be the largest antitrust case against a tech company in more than two decades.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Using the streaming platform Twitch, which American political figure was livestreamed playing the video game “Among Us” with the intention of motivating viewers to vote?
qa_2020.evidence: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, joined by fellow Democratic representative Ilhan Omar and other influencers, was livestreamed playing the video game. The stream peaked at 435,000 concurrent viewers, according to Twitch — one of the top 20 biggest streams ever.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which pharmaceutical company has agreed to plead guilty to federal criminal charges related to the opioid crisis?
qa_2020.evidence: Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin, has agreed to plead guilty to three federal criminal charges for its role in creating the nation’s opioid crisis and will pay more than $8 billion and close down the company.

qa_2020.question_sentence: According to Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe, Russia and which other country have allegedly retrieved voter information in an effort to disrupt the American election?
qa_2020.evidence: Ratcliffe said Iran and Russia have obtained US voter registration information, with Iran specifically sending “spoof emails designed to intimidate voters, incite social unrest and damage President (Donald) Trump.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: The final US presidential debate happened this week. What made it unique?
choices: It was the same moderator as the first debate
Microphones were muted for portions of the debate
It was shown on one television network
qa_2020.evidence: Learning from the chaos of the first debate, the Commission on Presidential Debates decided to mute the candidates’ microphones for portions of the event as a “move to promote adherence to rules.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: Dutch scientists may have discovered a new organ in which part of the human body?
qa_2020.evidence: When searching for tumorous growths, scientists discovered previously unnoticed glands in the throat. More than 100 individuals and two cadavers were sampled – they all had the glands.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which of these ‘policies’ did Kanye West announce during his first election rally?
choices: Free cars for all of his supporters
10 free face masks per month for every household
Everybody that has a baby gets paid $1m

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the name of Princess Beatrice’s newly wedded husband?
How much money did a lottery winner in Jamaica collect whilst dressed as Darth Vader this week?
What is the name of the Russian hacking group targeting global vaccine development efforts?
What percentage of an infected person's close contacts need to be contacted for track-and-trace to be effective?
Which US city is home to the Chinese consulate Donald trump ordered to be shut down?
Why has Venice announced that it is limiting the amount of people that can ride on its famous gondolas?
What percentage of New Delhi residents has new research suggested could have developed Covid-19 antibodies?
What is the name of the BBC journalist taking legal action against Jeremy Corbyn in the wake of the Panorama court case?
The Electoral Commission has revealed that how many Conservative ministers have accepted donations linked to Russia?
The mayor of which US city was tear gassed after attempting to speak to a crowd protesting for racial justice and against the presence of federal forces in the city?
qa_2020.evidence: Mayor Ted Wheeler of Portland, Oregon was tear gassed in the downtown section of the city. It’s unclear who launched the tear gas, but the incident comes after days of clashes between protestors and federal forces. In working to curb the violence, Wheeler said, “We did not ask the feds to be here. We do not want them here…and we’re demanding that they leave.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: A 93-year-old man, known as Bruno D, was charged with 5,230 counts of accessory to murder during his time as a Nazi SS guard at the Stutthof concentration camp during the Holocaust. In what country was the concentration camp located?
qa_2020.evidence: The Stutthof concentration camp, near the city of Gdansk, Poland, is a site where it’s estimated that over 65,000 people were murdered during WWII. This is a landmark decision out of Hamburg, Germany in that it’s likely one of the last Nazi trials in history and considered “symbolic justice” by many.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is NEOWISE?
choices: A new UN organization started to tackle the coronavirus pandemic
A project dedicated to the search for the building blocks of life on Mars
qa_2020.evidence: NEOWISE is a comet, discovered in late March, named after NASA’s Near-Earth Object Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer mission, the same program that discovered it. The comet will be visible to the naked eye in the Northern Hemisphere through the month of July and won’t make a pass by Earth for another 6,800 years.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which Black American Civil Rights icon died recently after a battle with cancer?
qa_2020.evidence: Congressman John Lewis of Georgia died after a long battle with cancer at the age of 80. Rev. Cordy Tindell “C.T.” Vivian, a fellow civil rights activist, died at the age of 95 on the same day of natural causes. Both were revered for their “good trouble” approach to activism, confronting injustices without violence as an impetus for social change.

qa_2020.question_sentence: US President Donald Trump tweeted a photo of himself wearing a mask and said wearing one displayed what character trait?
qa_2020.evidence: Trump tweeted a photo of himself wearing a mask saying that “many people say that it is Patriotic to wear a face mask when you can’t socially distance,” adding, “there is nobody more Patriotic than me, your favorite President!”. This comes after nearly three months of the CDC recommending face masks in public to effectively combat the spread of the coronavirus.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A $1.95 billion deal was reached between the US government and which pharmaceutical company to produce millions of Covid-19 vaccine doses?
qa_2020.evidence: The US department of Health and Human Services and Department of Defense announced that the deal was reached with Pfizer to produce 100 million doses of Covid-19 vaccine, with the US government being allowed to acquire an additional 500 million doses. Ultimately, the vaccine will need emergency use authorization from the US Food and Drug Administration to be distributed.

qa_2020.question_sentence: US investors are reportedly considering buying which Chinese video sharing app in order to alleviate US government security concerns and ensure its foothold in America?
qa_2020.evidence: US investors are reportedly eyeing a majority share in TikTok, a subsidiary of Chinese parent company ByteDance. TikTok has faced fierce criticism from the US government as tensions rise between China and the US over trade, national security, tech and human rights.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Washington NFL franchise, formerly known as the Washington Redskins, has officially been given what temporary name?
qa_2020.evidence: The Washington NFL franchise will be the Washington Football Team “pending adoption of a new team name.” The team decided to drop “Washington Redskins” after public pressure over the name’s racist overtones.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which teen activist has committed to donate $114,000 to fight coronavirus in the Brazilian Amazon?
qa_2020.evidence: Greta Thunberg of Sweden, 17, received the very first Gulbenkian Prize for Humanity, an award by Portugal’s Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation. Thunberg announced that she’s donating $114,000 of the $1.4 million prize to SOS Amazônia, an environmental organization working to defend the rainforests and fight the coronavirus pandemic in indigenous territories of the Amazon.

qa_2020.question_sentence: As of Friday, Hurricane Douglas was brewing near which US state?
qa_2020.evidence: Hurricane Douglas was heading towards Hawaii but will likely weaken before reaching the islands on Sunday. Given the Hawiian Islands’ small area in the Pacific Ocean, the probability for hurricanes to make direct landfall is statistically low.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A North Korean gymnast is reported to have used which innovative method to escape the country recently?
choices: Folded himself into a suitcase and got smuggled out
Pretended to be a member of a visiting Chinese team
Swam across sea border to South Korea

qa_2020.question_sentence: Efforts to reach a Brexit deal were hit this week by a new stand-off over what food item?
Which sectors of the UK economy would be hardest hit by a no-deal Brexit, according to a new report by the Office for Budget Responsibility?
choices: Agriculture, renewable energy, manufacturing and IT
Retail, real estate, hospitality and education
Agriculture, real estate, mining and finance

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which ‘zombie’ animals have been rising from their graves in Denmark owing to gases released during decomposition, after being culled over Covid mutation fears?
The discovery of what mysterious object in a remote part of the Utah desert has triggered a series of conspiracy theories?
choices: A crashed Second World War plane
Pre-historic carvings on the desert floor

qa_2020.question_sentence: Between which dates will bubbles of up to three households be allowed to mix over Christmas?
Who has surpassed Bill Gates to become the world’s second-richest person?
A 180-year-old phrasebook recently unearthed by archivists was designed to help English people do what?
choices: Communicate with French traders for business purposes
Avoid appearing “common” when mixing with aristocrats

qa_2020.question_sentence: A man was arrested after doing what to express his anger at being asked to leave a restaurant in the Canadian city of Ontario this week?
choices: Battering a waiter with a massive steak

qa_2020.question_sentence: Latest trial results for the Oxford Covid vaccine have been questioned after what was discovered about test patients in the group in which the jab was most effective?
choices: Almost 10% remained in self-isolation during the trials
Up to 20% were not tested for Covid properly

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the name of the London-based private members’ club whose members are being ‘groomed’ by China, according to a new book?
Which city has become the first in Britain to be put under a local lockdown?
Boris Johnson has condemned China’s newly imposed national security laws for Hong Kong as a “clear and serious breach” of which treaty?
choices: Treaty of Amity and Cooperation in Southeast Asia

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which of the following retailers this week warned of job cuts and store closures?
Ethiopian troops have been deployed to deal with unrest sparked by the assassination of which popular musician?
Which Royal has apologised for the lack of progress in combating institutional racism that he claims remains ‘endemic’ in society?
The US has snapped up the global supply of which coronavirus treatment drug?
The UK government is reportedly set to allow quarantine-free travel to up to how many countries deemed low risk for coronavirus?
White House insiders reportedly told US journalist Carl Bernstein that Donald Trump called which world leader ‘stupid’?
Which animal has been linked to a new type of flu virus with ‘pandemic potential’ discovered in China?
As efforts to curb hate speech online intensify, which online platform has suspended an account belonging to the Trump campaign?
qa_2020.evidence: Twitch, an Amazon-owned streaming platform popular with online gamers, said content posted by President Donald Trump’s campaign channel violated its policies on hate. Among the content that Twitch said violated its policies was a recently rebroadcast video of a 2016 campaign rally in which he called Mexicans rapists and criminals.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Supreme Court struck down a Louisiana law that critics say would have closed nearly every abortion clinic in the state. A similar law was struck down in 2016 in which US state?
qa_2020.evidence: The law barred doctors from performing the procedure unless they had admitting privileges at a nearby hospital. In a 5-4 ruling blocking it, conservative Chief Justice John Roberts cited the precedent set by the Supreme Court striking down a similar law in Texas.

qa_2020.question_sentence: According to reports, American intelligence concluded that Russian actors were offering bounties to militants in which country if they killed US and UK troops there?
qa_2020.evidence: A report from The New York Times, later confirmed by CNN, suggests that Russia offered rewards to Taliban militants in Afghanistan for the deaths of US and UK servicemembers.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The European Union is banning tourists from certain countries due to coronavirus concerns. Travelers from which of the following countries will not be allowed entry?
qa_2020.evidence: Starting July 1, European nations are opening their borders to travelers from 15 countries outside of the bloc. Brazil, along with Russia, India and the United States, is not on the list. The four countries have the highest number of cases in the world.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) at the Port of New York/Newark seized a shipment of beauty products worth more than $800,000. They were suspected to be made from what item?
qa_2020.evidence: CBP officials said the 13-ton shipment originated in Xinjiang, China, indicating possible human rights abuses of those forcibly imprisoned. Xinjiang is home to roughly 11 million Uyghurs, a predominantly Muslim ethnic minority. An estimated one million Uyghurs have been systematically detained in massive networks of internment camps.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which company announced this week that it would ban the terms “master,” “slave” and “blacklist” from its code?
qa_2020.evidence: Twitter dropped the terms after two engineers lobbied for programming language without racist connotations. The terms “master” and “slave” refer to a process in the code that controls another, while “blacklist” describes a list of items that are automatically blocked.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which professional sports team announced it would review its name after growing pressure?
qa_2020.evidence: The NFL’s Washington Redskins have long been criticized for their team name, which critics argue is based on a historically offensive slur against Native Americans.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Russians voters overwhelmingly approved a set of constitutional amendments that would potentially allow President Vladimir Putin to stay in power until what year?
qa_2020.evidence: The changes to the constitution effectively reset the clock on Putin’s term limits, allowing him to seek two more six-year terms when his presidency ends in 2024.

qa_2020.question_sentence: More than 360 elephants have died in mysterious circumstances over the past three months in what African country?
qa_2020.evidence: Conservationists said some carcasses were found clustered around waterholes. Other elephants appeared to have died by falling flat on their faces. Botswana is home to 130,000 African elephants – more than any other country on the continent.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which singer wrote an open letter to Netflix, criticizing its decision to air the erotic kidnap film “365 Days?”
qa_2020.evidence: Welsh singer Duffy, who revealed earlier this year that she had been kidnapped and raped, wrote that the film glamorizes sexual violence. The film tells the story of a woman who is abducted, imprisoned and repeatedly sexually abused by a mafia boss who gives her one year to fall in love with him.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The brains of which animal have been ‘hijacked’ to help sniff out bombs in tests by US researchers?
The latest annual Femicide Census shows that what percentage of women killed by men in the UK were murdered by a former or current partner?
Home Secretary Priti Patel reportedly tried to oust which senior member of her department?
At which London mosque was a man in his 70s stabbed while leading the call to prayer?
Which of these explanations was NOT offered by Pakistani officials for the sudden deaths of 14 people in a Karachi neighbourhood this week?
choices: Leak of toxic gas methyl bromide

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which wannabe US presidential candidate made their Democratic debate debut in Las Vegas this week?
Which Downing Street figure called for the NHS to pay for “designer babies” in a newly uncovered 2014 blog post?
Where did the UK place in the Tax Justice Network’s latest rankings of the world’s most secretive financial systems?
The Royal Mail has released a new set of stamps to celebrate which 2020 film?
Which artist won Album of the Year at the 2020 Brit Awards?
Which university waived tuition this week for families making less than $80,000 a year?
choices: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
qa_2020.evidence: USC announced Thursday that families with an annual income of $80,000 or less can attend the private university tuition-free, starting with students entering their first year this fall. Owning a home will also no longer be considered when determining a student's financial need, the school said.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Football player Gregory Robinson was arrested this week for allegedly possessing 157 pounds of marijuana. What team does Robinson play for?
qa_2020.evidence: Robinson, an offensive tackle for the Browns, will be an unrestricted free agent next month. He was charged in a federal complaint with conspiracy to possess with intent to distribute marijuana and possession intent to distribute

qa_2020.question_sentence: Larry Tesler died this week at the age of 74. He was the creator of which popular keyboard function?
qa_2020.evidence: Tesler was a pioneer of personal computing credited with creating the cut, copy and paste as well as the search and replace functions. He played an early, central role in making computers accessible.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which former governor did President Donald Trump grant clemency to this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Trump granted clemency to former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich. He served eight years of a 14-year prison sentence after being accused of attempting to sell a US senate seat.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which diet was found by a new study to improve brain function and prevent the development of chronic diseases such as diabetes and cancer?
qa_2020.evidence: A study published Monday found that following the Mediterranean diet, which consists of lots of fruits, vegetables, nuts and fish, and little red meat and sugar altered the microbiome of elderly people in ways that would aid in longevity.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which home furnishings retailer filed for bankruptcy this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Pier 1, which has closed hundreds of stores in recent years, filed for bankruptcy Monday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: When do scientists think all of Earth’s coral reef habitats will be destroyed by climate change?
qa_2020.evidence: Scientists from the University of Hawaii Manoa warn that by 2100, “few to zero suitable coral habitats will remain.” The crisis can only be averted if “we take drastic action on climate change,” researchers said.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Chinese government expelled three reporters from which news outlet this week?
qa_2020.evidence: The Chinese government revoked the press credentials of three Wall Street Journal reporters over an opinion piece that criticized China’s initial reaction to the novel coronavirus outbreak.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which comedians are performing at this year's White House Correspondents' Dinner?
qa_2020.evidence: Hasan Minhaj, who performed at the dinner in 2017, will return for this year's event on Saturday, April 25, 2020.The association also announced another comedian as the host for the evening: Kenan Thompson.

qa_2020.question_sentence: NASCAR driver Ryan Newman was released from the hospital Wednesday, just two days after his terrifying crash during the last lap of which race?
qa_2020.evidence: Ryan Newman, leading the final lap of NASCAR's Daytona 500, was involved in a fiery crash Monday that saw his car spin and go airborne, flipping several times. On Wednesday, Roush Fenway Racing tweeted a photo of Newman walking out of the hospital with his two daughters.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Clinical trials have found that antiviral drug remdesivir can cut average Covid-19 recovery times to how many days?
According to the World Travel and Tourism Council, what proportion of jobs worldwide were sustained by tourism before the coronavirus pandemic?
Odeon Cinemas-owner AMC Theatres has said it will no longer screen movies by which film company?
Newly released figures show that US gross domestic product (GDP) shrank by how much in the first quarter of 2020?
The boss of which supermarket chain says that the coronavirus outbreak has put the weekly shop back in fashion?
Children classed as vulnerable are being encouraged to attend school in England, but Department for Education figures show that how many actually did so last week?
What percentage of Covid-19 patients in UK hospitals are male?
Dogs wearing GoPro cameras are to give tours of celebrities’ houses in a newly announced Channel 4 show called what?
Which of these was NOT included in 100th birthday celebrations for NHS fundraiser and war veteran Captain Tom Moore on Thursday?
Which Hollywood actor and keen pilot is being investigated by US aviation authorities after a runway mishap this week?
A US embassy in what country was attacked by protesters demonstrating against American airstrikes?
qa_2020.evidence: Pro-Iranian  demonstrators -- mostly from a coalition of predominantly Shiite militias -- tried to storm the US embassy in Baghdad. They were protesting five US airstrikes on militia-controlled facilities in Iraq and Syria that killed 25 and wounded 51.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This artist is the first to score a No. 1 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 chart across four different decades.
qa_2020.evidence: Carey’s holiday earworm, “All I Want for Christmas Is You,” topped the Billboard chart in the 1990s, 2000s, 2010s and finally, the 2020s. Carey released a new music video in December that ushered the song into 2020 with a steady stream of new views.

qa_2020.question_sentence: New Year’s fireworks displays in this city happened despite a public petition calling for them to be cancelled.
qa_2020.evidence: Australian officials faced increasing pressure to cancel the event in the midst of a devastating bushfire season. More than a quarter of a million people signed a petition calling for the money that’s usually spent on the fireworks display to go toward firefighting efforts.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The US Army has banned soldiers from using which popular app on government-owned phones?
