qa_2020.evidence: The US Army joined the Navy in barring use of the app on government-owned phones after lawmakers raised concerns about whether the Chinese-owned app presents risks to national security or Americans’ personal data information.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Five people were wounded during a religious celebration when a man entered and attacked the faithful with a machete. Which religious tradition did the victims belong to?
qa_2020.evidence: The attacker entered the New York home of a rabbi where a Hanukkah celebration was taking place. There were nearly 100 people in the home at the time of the attack, an attendee said. Five people, including the rabbi’s son, were taken to a hospital.

qa_2020.question_sentence: On January 1, a law went into effect that legalizes recreational marijuana in which state?
qa_2020.evidence: The law, which passed in June, lets anyone 21 and older buy and possess recreational marijuana. It also pardons people with nonviolent convictions of having up to 30 grams of cannabis.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Earthlings ushered in a new decade this week. People in which places got to celebrate the New Year first?
qa_2020.evidence: Of places across all 39 time zones, these Pacific Islands fall at the head of the pack, saying hello to 2020 before the rest of the world.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which two companies are suing California over its law that requires “gig workers” to be considered employees instead of independent contractors?
qa_2020.evidence: The companies filed suit in federal court, claiming the law violates parts of the US and California constitutions.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A new report ranks this diet as the “best” diet for the third year in a row.
qa_2020.evidence: A panel of judges ranked diets based on factors including balance, maintainability, sustainability and healthfulness. The Mediterranean diet -- which emphasizes plant-based cooking with less red meat and more olive oil and fish -- snatched the top spot.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which Democratic presidential candidate announced the end of their campaign this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Castro, the only Latino to run in the 2020 election cycle, announced the end of his campaign in a video posted to Twitter. The candidate struggled to raise enough money and support in polls over the last year.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the name of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s new charity?
By how much has Cancer Research UK had to cut its research budget owing to a fundraising crisis triggered by the coronavirus pandemic?
What is the name of the Labour mayor expelled from the party for saying Boris Johnson ‘deserves’ to be in intensive care with the Covid-19 coronavirus?
Debenhams is set to file for administration amid lockdown trading woes, putting the jobs of the chain store’s how many employees at risk?
How many words did the Queen utter in her televised address to the nation this week?
This week marks the anniversary of the start of the Rwanda genocide, which saw around 800,000 people slaughtered by ethnic Hutu extremists in which year?
Scotland’s chief medical officer, Catherine Calderwood,  has resigned after being caught breaking her own lockdown rules by doing what?
choices: Taking a trip to her second home

qa_2020.question_sentence: The plan for a gradual withdrawal from the UK lockdown that has been put forward by Boris Johnson’s former economics advisor Gerard Lyons is known as what?
Keir Starmer has appointed former Labour leader Ed Miliband to which role in his new shadow cabinet?
Approximately how many months pregnant is Boris Johnson’s fiancee, Carrie Symonds?
This state held its primary elections this week in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, despite efforts to delay the election until June.
qa_2020.evidence: Every other state with an election scheduled for April postponed their contest or shifted it to by-mail voting only. But Wisconsin pressed forward. The event raised questions over voting rights, as many were forced to don masks or other protective gear and wait in long lines.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A special supermoon graced skies around the world this week. What was it called?
qa_2020.evidence: Supermoons occur when the moon is within 90% of perigee -- which is its closest approach to Earth in orbit. The moon appeared brighter and bigger in the night sky on Tuesday night. April's full moon, called the "pink moon" because of native North American wildflowers that bloom in early springtime, was the closest of the year.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This musician accused Usher of copying his style this week in an interview.
qa_2020.evidence: The Weeknd said he thinks Usher heard his 2011 mixtape "House of Balloons," borrowed his style, then made it his own to make his 2012 song "Climax."

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which two cities could be the next hotspots of the coronavirus pandemic, according to information released this week?
qa_2020.evidence: On a conference call with House Democrats, White House coronavirus response coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx said the Philadelphia and DC areas are expected to be the new hot spots. They also are carefully watching the Houston area, one of the most populous regions in the country.

qa_2020.question_sentence: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson was released from intensive care on Thursday, after dealing with coronavirus symptoms. How many days was Johnson in intensive care before he was released?
qa_2020.evidence: Johnson, 55, was first taken to London's St. Thomas' Hospital on Sunday, and after his condition worsened, he was sent to the ICU on Monday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Vice President Mike Pence's office has prohibited the nation's top health officials to appear on what television network?
qa_2020.evidence: Pence's office said it will only allow experts such as Dr. Deborah Birx or Dr. Anthony Fauci to appear on CNN if the network fully televises the White House briefings on the coronavirus. CNN often only broadcasts President Donald Trump's question and answer session, which sometimes includes the health care officials, live on-air. After Trump leaves the podium, CNN frequently cuts out of the White House briefing to discuss and fact-check. The full briefing can run more than two hours.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This popular Canadian sitcom aired its last episode this week, after six seasons of episodes.
qa_2020.evidence: "Schitt's Creek" aired its final episode on Tuesday.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which restaurant chain began selling a mix of its signature item, before selling out in about four hours?
qa_2020.evidence: The popular restaurant chain, which like many closed its stores due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, announced Wednesday that it sold out of bags of its waffle mix just four hours after they became available for purchase.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which type of juice has experienced soaring sales as a result of the coronavirus pandemic?
qa_2020.evidence: US retail sales of orange juice jumped about 38% in the four weeks ending on March 28 compared to the same period last year, according to Nielsen.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Ellen DeGeneres sparked backlash this week, after jokingly comparing quarantine to what?
choices: Being stuck on a deserted island
qa_2020.evidence: One of Ellen DeGeneres' jokes backfired this week after some people called her out for comparing self-quarantining during the coronavirus pandemic to "being in jail." The comparison was deemed "tone deaf" by some viewers.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Scientists are struggling to explain a recent spate of attacks on boats in the Strait of Gibraltar by which animals?
How many Tory MPs abstained or voted against Boris Johnson’s controversial Internal Market Bill this week?
The UK’s bid to achieve “net zero” carbon emissions by 2050 has been dealt a blow by Japanese firm Hitachi’s decision to scrap plans to build a new nuclear power station where?
Which date this week marked the 400th anniversary of the day that the Mayflower and the ship’s Pilgrim Father passengers set sail from Plymouth to the US?
Scientists this week announced the discovery of phosphine, a gas that may be a sign of biological activity, in clouds above which planet?
Newly released data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) show that a total of how many payroll jobs were lost in the UK in the first five months of the coronavirus pandemic?
The 42-sq-mile Spalte Glacier has split from an ice shelf and shattered, following decades of climate change, but where is the broken glacier located?

Mining company Rio Tinto is searching for a new chief executive after boss Jean-Sebastien Jacques resigned over the destruction of a sacred Aboriginal site in Western Australia that dated back how many years?
A ‘Support Our Troops’ fundraising advert for the Donald Trump presidential campaign has attracted ridicule for featuring what?
choices: Silhouetted images of Russian fighter jets
A slogan associated with the Nazi Party
Incorrect claims about the Republican Party

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which former footballer is reportedly being lined up to replace Sue Barker as host of BBC quiz show A Question of Sport?
Which US state was forced to postpone the initial September 14th sending of absentee and mail-in ballots due to a slew of lawsuits and other issues?
qa_2020.evidence: With less than 8 weeks until Election Day, Pennsylvania delayed the sending of ballots for several reasons, including several lawsuits, one currently ongoing with the Green Party. The commonwealth is a critical battleground state in which Donald Trump won by less than 1 point in 2016.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Facebook has decided to move forward with purchasing the previously unused headquarters of which American outdoor retailer?
qa_2020.evidence: Despite positioning more of its employees to work remotely, Facebook will be purchasing the Bellevue, Washington space from REI, a co-op owned by its customers. REI announced in August its intention to sell the unused 400,000-square-foot campus.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Phosphine gas, typically associated with life, was found in the atmosphere of what planet?
qa_2020.evidence: Venus’ atmosphere has been found to harbor phosphine, a gas found on Earth and omitted when organic material breaks down. The study, announced in the journal Nature Astronomy, does not fully explain the cause but has theories as to the gas’ origin.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which American publication announced, for the first time in its 175-year history, an endorsement for a US presidential candidate?
qa_2020.evidence: Scientific American announced its endorsement of Joe Biden, the first time the publication has endorsed a presidential candidate. In a major rebuke of US President Donald Trump, the magazine said, “The most devastating example is his dishonest and inept response to the COVID-19 pandemic, which cost more than 190,000 Americans their lives by the middle of September.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which US city announced it would pay the family of Breonna Taylor, a Black woman killed by police in her home, $12 million as part of wrongful death lawsuit?
qa_2020.evidence: Louisville, Kentucky, has agreed to pay Breonna Taylor’s family $12 million as part of a wrongful death lawsuit. The city also committed to sweeping police reforms as part of the deal.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A Congressional House report was released this week that found which company downplayed known “catastrophic” systems errors?
qa_2020.evidence: The House Transportation Committee released its report on Boeing and the known flawed “Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System” featured on its 737 Max airliner, which ultimately contributed to the crashes of Lion Air Flight 610 and Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The normalization of diplomatic relations between Israel and which two Arab countries was formally ratified this week?
qa_2020.evidence: In a White House-organized ceremony, diplomatic relations were formally opened between Israel and Arab countries Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates –a historic agreement known as the Abraham Accords. The last time such a ceremony took place was in 1994 when then-President Bill Clinton helped facilitate a peace deal between Israel and Jordan.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The US Commerce Department officially announced it will ban the download of TikTok and which other Chinese-owned app starting Sunday?
qa_2020.evidence: TikTok and WeChat will be banned for download as well as incur other restrictions, according to the Commerce Department. All of this is with the intention to “guarantee our national security and protect Americans from the threats of the Chinese Communist Party,” Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said in a statement.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Traces of Novichok, a powerful nerve agent, were apparently found on what object, suggesting that Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny was poisoned before heading to the Tomsk, Sibera, airport?
qa_2020.evidence: Alexey Navalny’s team said that they found traces of Novichok on a water bottle left behind in the Kremlin critic’s Sibera hotel room, though they could not definitively prove it was the primary point of poisoning.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Announced this week, which iconic American event will still go on but “shift to a television-only special presentation” due to the coronavirus pandemic?
choices: Times Square New Year's Eve celebration
qa_2020.evidence: The Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade, which to many signifies the start of the holiday season, will still go on, but without in-person spectators. Staff will be significantly reduced and only allow folks over 18 years of age to participate. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio said, “They are re-inventing the event for this moment in history.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: What is the name of the government’s plan to take stakes in key British industries to stave off business collapses and job losses?
How many miles did Dominic Cummings controversially drive from his home in London, to his parents’ farm in Durham?
How many people has the British government said it will recruit by the middle of May as part of its plan to rollout contact tracing?
Who was this week revealed to have given Boris Johnson permission to exercise in the grounds of Lambeth Palace?
Tensions between India and China are rising, but in which year did the two countries fight a brief war that established the border between them?
How much is the controversial Saudi-backed offer to buy Newcastle United Football Club from Sports Direct owner Mike Ashley worth?
Where did protests break out this week following the death of George Floyd, an unarmed black man who died after a police officer knelt on his neck for more than eight minutes?
Which country’s most senior public health official has claimed the coronavirus could have been controlled in their nation without a lockdown?
Which European country burned hundreds of thousands of face masks, just weeks before the coronavirus arrived on the continent?
Which UK police force is facing inquiries after six black men claimed they were wrongly tasered by officers?
Which European country eased coronavirus restrictions on Monday so some citizens in cross-border relationships could reunite with their partners?
qa_2020.evidence: Denmark’s relaxed border controls apply only to permanent residents of its neighboring nations – Germany, Sweden, Norway and Finland. Couples must also have met regularly in person to be considered under the policy.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This area of the world has been deemed the new epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak, surpassing other regions for the highest daily number of reported infections.
qa_2020.evidence: Latin America has surpassed Europe and the US in the daily number of reported Covid-19 infections, according to the director of the Pan American Health Organization.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which actor revealed he almost turned down his starring role in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
qa_2020.evidence: Evans, best known as Captain America, said he initially didn’t want to take the role because he’d been dealing with severe anxiety for several years and was questioning his acting pursuit.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Protests are raging nationwide after George Floyd, a black man, died after a confrontation with police. In what city did the incident take place?
qa_2020.evidence: Floyd’s death has resulted in protests across Minneapolis, after footage was released showing an officer kneeling on the back of his neck.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The US death toll from coronavirus topped what monumental number this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Passing the 100,000 mark means an average of almost 900 Americans died each day since the first known coronavirus-related death nearly 4 months ago. While the number of new cases each day is slowly declining in parts of the US, the overall death toll keeps rising.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Anifa Mvuemba, the designer behind the brand Hanifa, gave a widely-shared preview of what catwalks might look like in a post-pandemic world, with a collection using virtual models. What country is Mvuemba from?
qa_2020.evidence: The Congolese designer, whose previous designs have been worn by celebrities such as rapper Cardi B, said she already had plans to go digital with her collection before various Covid-19 restrictions were put in place.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The NBA is continuins to explore options on a potential return to play. The most recent option would see players and some family members quarantining together at what location?
choices: ESPN’s Wide World of Sports Complex in Orlando
qa_2020.evidence: The NBA players association and the league are in talks with Disney to hold the rest of the season at the ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex, as a single campus for all activities.

qa_2020.question_sentence: According to new guidance from the CDC, antibody tests used to determine if people have previously been infected with Covid-19 could be wrong up to what percent of the time?
qa_2020.evidence: Because the tests might be wrong up to half of the time, those who rely on antibody tests may need to use the most accurate test they can find and possibly test people twice, the CDC said in the new guidance.

qa_2020.question_sentence: It’s the return of the chicken sandwich wars. Which fast food chain recently announced it’s testing a new chicken sandwich?
qa_2020.evidence: KFC, with chicken in its name, has surprisingly found itself playing catch-up against rival chains’ sandwiches. Fifteen locations in Orlando, Florida, will sell the sandwich through June 21.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The US Department of Justice on Thursday unsealed criminal charges against more than two dozen bankers, alleging they were behind an international money laundering scheme that moved some $2.5 billion in violation of US sanctions. Where were these bankers from?
qa_2020.evidence: Twenty-eight North Korean nationals face a slew of charges related to bank fraud, money laundering and criminal enterprises, in what appears to be the first case brought against members of the North Korean financial system.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A new strain of which common sexually transmitted infection (STI) has been found lurking in the Arctic seabed?
Which militant organisation has overtaken Islamic State as the world’s “deadliest terror group”, according to a new report from defence intelligence experts?
Which country has pledged to significantly ramp up oil production in order to support Saudi Arabia’s oil price war against Russia?
Which joyous, boozy festival celebrated earlier this week is dubbed the “Jewish Mardi Gras”?
WikiLeaks whistle-blower Chelsea Manning was released from custody on Thursday after almost a year in jail for contempt of court - but which offence was she NOT convicted of in 2013?
In his debut Budget, Chancellor Rishi Sunak unveiled a stimulus package totalling how much to boost the UK economy?
Donald Trump announced a ban on flights from Europe’s Schengen zone to the US that is currently scheduled to last for how long?
The partner of which world leader has tested positive for coronavirus?
Which company has bought energy-drink maker Rockstar for $3.85bn?
Which newly released film has offended critics including Donald Trump?
The United States census is underway. How often does this nationwide head count take place?
qa_2020.evidence: The US census happens every ten years.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Joe Biden gained significant ground in the race for the Democratic  when six states went to the polls on Tuesday. Which state that voted had the most delegates up for grabs?
qa_2020.evidence: Biden won Michigan, which was the biggest prize of the night with 125 delegates.

qa_2020.question_sentence: This country went under complete lockdown to try and curb the dire coronavirus situation growing within its borders.
qa_2020.evidence: Italy went under a complete lockdown to try and combat the coronavirus. It is currently dealing with the worst coronavirus outbreak in Europe.

qa_2020.question_sentence: An international scandal involving the administration of performance-enhancing drugs is rocking which sporting community?
qa_2020.evidence: Twenty-seven trainers trainers, veterinarians and drug distributors have been indicted in a scheme to administer performance-enhancing drugs to racehorses.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Modell’s Sporting Goods has announced it is filing for bankruptcy and closing all stores. What was the retail chain’s famous tagline?
qa_2020.evidence: “Gotta go to Mo’s” has appeared on billboards and in jingles for the sporting goods store for decades.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Sports leagues across the US cancelled playoffs, suspended seasons and postponed openings due to the coronavirus threat. Which of these leagues had a player test positive for Coronavirus?
qa_2020.evidence: The NBA suspended its season after a Utah Jazz player tested positive for coronavirus.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which world leader’s country approved changes to their constitution, allowing him to stay in power long after the regular terms of his presidency run out?
qa_2020.evidence: Vladimir Putin has voiced support for change to the Russian constitution that could extend his presidency to 2036.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What country has made drastic threats to fight for its share in the oil market, leading experts to worry their actions could sink the entire global economy?
qa_2020.evidence: Saudi Arabia has broken agreements with global oil powers and threatened to increase its oil production, setting the entire oil market on edge and causing worldwide markets to drop.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Turkey recently broke an agreement with the European Union and began letting migrants cross the country’s border, creating a migrant crisis in what European country?
qa_2020.evidence: Greece is staying firm in keeping its borders closed to migrants, creating a backup of people along its border with Turkey.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A new environmental report has issued a dire warning that this ecological wonder, if not taken proper care of, could be decimated within a span of 50 years.
qa_2020.evidence: Scientists have warned that it would only take 50 years for the Amazon Rainforest to become a grassy savannah if measures aren't taken to prevent its collapse.

qa_2020.question_sentence: How many English primary schools are currently expected to remain closed on 1 June, as local councils rebel against the government’s lockdown lifting policy?
Which sportsman this week smashed an auction world record when a pair of his trainers sold for $560,000?
How much are Prince Harry and Meghan Markle shelling out each month to keep Frogmore Cottage as their UK base, as part of a “rental-plus” agreement to repay renovation costs?
The residents of which UK town have purchased the most sex toys since the coronavirus lockdown began, according to a new analysis?
Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Ronan Farrow has been accused of being “too good to be true” by a writer for which newspaper?
How much weight have French citizens reportedly gained on average under lockdown?
What territory has Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu threatened to annex as part of a power-sharing agreement with former political rival Benny Gantz?
Which UK university has become the first to announce that all of its lectures in the upcoming academic year are to be held online?
A newly released reports says that the total cost of security to protect MPs in 2018 was how much?
A new poll has found that how many pubs, bars and restaurants may remain closed after the UK lockdown ends?
A cyclone hit which part of the world this week, killing more than 80 people and leaving thousands homeless?
qa_2020.evidence: Cyclone Amphan slammed into coastal towns and cities in India and Bangladesh on Wednesday afternoon. It was the most powerful cyclone ever recorded in the Bay of Bengal.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which country banned people from legally changing their gender this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Hungary’s parliament voted Tuesday to stop transgender and intersex people from changing their gender on identity documents, in a move rights groups said could lead to further intolerance and discrimination against the LGBTQ community.

qa_2020.question_sentence: After the success of “The Last Dance,” ESPN announced it would produce a similar docuseries about what other legendary athlete?
qa_2020.evidence: Titled “The Man in the Arena: Tom Brady,” the next series will explore each of Brady’s nine Super Bowl journeys with the New England Patriots, showing his perspective through his six titles and three Super Bowl defeats.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A Pakistan International Airlines flight crashed in which Pakistani city on Friday?
qa_2020.evidence: At least 38 people died when the plane crashed in Karachi, Pakistan’s largest city.

qa_2020.question_sentence: About what percentage of coronavirus infections are asymptomatic, according to new guidance from the CDC?
qa_2020.evidence: With about 35% of infections being asymptomatic, that means many could be transmitting the virus without even knowing it.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The man who recorded the fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery has been arrested on charges including felony murder. What is his name?
qa_2020.evidence: Bryan recorded the shooting, and his attorney has maintained that he is innocent of any wrongdoing.

qa_2020.question_sentence: President Donald Trump has urged Americans to try which drug as a potential coronavirus cure, if their doctors agree?
qa_2020.evidence: Retail sales of hydroxychloroquine, an anti-malarial drug Trump claims to be taking himself, have been soaring as a result of his promotion.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Actress Lori Loughlin and husband, fashion designer Mossimo Giannulli, agreed to plead guilty to conspiracy charges in connection to their role in the college admissions scam this week. What school did they try to send their children to?
choices: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of California at Los Angeles
qa_2020.evidence: Loughlin, 55, and Giannulli, 56, had been accused of paying $500,000 to get their two daughters into the University of Southern California as fake crew team recruits.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Michael Cohen was released from prison on Thursday and is expected to serve out the remainder of his sentence at home, as coronavirus continues to spread behind bars. Cohen played what role in Trump’s circle?
qa_2020.evidence: Cohen, Trump’s former personal attorney, was serving a 3-year sentence after pleading guilty to lying to Congress, tax charges and two campaign finance charges for facilitating hush money payments to two women who alleged affairs with Trump.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Signaling temperature increases and climate change, snow is turning what color in Antarctica?
qa_2020.evidence: Green snow created by blooming algae in the Antarctic Peninsula is likely to spread as temperatures increase as a result of climate change, researchers have said.

qa_2020.question_sentence: How many days have passed between the referendum in which the UK voted to quit the EU and Britain’s official exit from the bloc this week?
Experts are warning that the climate crisis could trigger the collapse of the Antarctic Treaty, but when was the agreement first signed?
How many cups of tea were brewed in the UK during the year to February 2019?
Which sea has been found to cause greenhouse gas pollution as bad as that produced by major oil nations?
Which song was sung in the European Parliament this week after MEPs voted to approve Britain’s departure from the EU?
choices: With a Little Help From My Friends

qa_2020.question_sentence: John McEnroe and Martina Navratilova have staged a protest calling for the name of an arena named after which former tennis player to be changed?
Which BBC presenter has suggested that the licence fee should become voluntary?
Late BBC radio host Nicholas Parsons helmed every episode of Just A Minute for how many years before a bout of flu broke his uninterrupted run?
As debt worries peak in January, the Citizen’s Advice Bureau gets a call from someone seeking helping how often on average?
How much did the UK's biggest taxpayer, Bet365 founder Denise Coates, reportedly pay to HMRC last year?

Former national security adviser John Bolton was formally warned by the White House about publishing his upcoming memoir, which contains allegations about President Trump and his dealings with Ukraine. What is the Broadway musical-inspired title of the memoir?
choices: At the End of the Day
qa_2020.evidence: Bolton’s book is titled “The Room Where It Happened,” which is the title of a song from the musical “Hamilton.”

qa_2020.question_sentence: There is one US state that currently has no regular commercial airline service. Which one is it?
qa_2020.evidence: Delaware has no regular commercial flights, but that will change when Frontier Airlines brings service back to the state’s New Castle Airport this May.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The UK’s Prince Andrew is reportedly not cooperating in the FBI investigation of what person, with whom the Prince had a friendship?
qa_2020.evidence: Prince Andrew is facing several allegations of sexual misconduct related to his friendship with the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Following a disastrous BBC interview last year, the Prince agreed to speak with the FBI if they sought to interview him.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which young performer swept the four major categories at the Grammys, taking home awards for best new artist, record of the year, song of the year and album of the year?
qa_2020.evidence: Eighteen-year-old “Bad Guy” singer Billie Eilish made Grammy’s history. She also the first woman to ever win all four of the top category Grammys in the same year.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Trump Administration rolled out a plan to address the relationship between Israelis and Palestinians in the Middle East. What close associate led the creation of the plan?
choices: Stephen Miller, one of Trump’s senior advisers
qa_2020.evidence: Jared Kushner, Trump’s son-in-law and senior adviser, led the plan, which was poorly received by Palestinians.

qa_2020.question_sentence: People around the world are still mourning the loss of NBA star Kobe Bryant, who died in a helicopter crash along with eight others. One of the most common tributes is the display of this jersey number, which Bryant wore for the majority of his time with the LA Lakers.
qa_2020.evidence: Bryant wore the number 24 from 2006 to the time he retired from the league in 2016.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Iowa caucus takes place Monday, February 3rd. How is caucus voting different than traditional primary voting?
choices: Voters physically move around to choose the candidates they want
Voters shout their votes in order to be counted
Voters show up to different buildings designated for each candidate
Voters place tokens in buckets to cast their vote
qa_2020.evidence: Voters at different precincts  move to different parts of the room designated for each candidate. These votes are then translated into delegate counts, and whoever gets the most delegates the pledge their votes wins.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which popular brand made an unexpected leap into fashion by launching a clothing line?
qa_2020.evidence: Popeye’s lovers can now purchase a version of the fast food chain’s uniforms, but fashion forward fans noticed the collection looks very similar to Beyoncé’s latest release from her Ivy Park activewear brand.

qa_2020.question_sentence: As countries scramble to prevent the spread of the Wuhan coronavirus, about 7,000 people were quarantined in what place in Italy among fears someone among them was infected with the virus?
qa_2020.evidence: About 7,000 people were kept on a Costa cruise ship in Italy while one of the passengers was tested for the virus.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The UK officially separated from the EU on January 31st. However, the UK will have a transition period to get trade deals and other logistical issues in place. How long do they have?
qa_2020.evidence: Brexit’s “implementation period” will last until December 31st, 2020.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Amazon boss Jeff Bezos’s​ phone was reportedly hacked via a WhatsApp video file sent from a number belonging to which world leader?
In which two countries did Reddit users line up pieces of bread on exact opposite sides of the planet to create an “Earth sandwich”?
Why did the US National Weather Service this week warn that iguanas may fall from trees in Florida?
choices: The reptiles are dying from a lethal bacterial disease
They’re falling asleep owing to unseasonably warm weather
They’re frozen solid following unseasonably cold weather
They keep pushing each other off their perches

qa_2020.question_sentence: What did Donald Trump call climate crisis activists during a speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos?
How many additional staff is social media giant Facebook planning to hire in London this year?
New figures show that the homicide rate in Mexico hit a record high in 2019 - how many people on average were killed each day?
What is the name of the BBC director general who has announced he is standing down after seven years in the role?
Beales entered administration this week, putting at risk jobs at the department store chain’s how many UK outlets?
What is a US company going to attempt to retrieve from the Titanic in a controversial salvage operation?
choices: The radio that relayed the sinking ship’s final plea for help

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which fashion brand has been accused of cultural appropriation after sending models wearing cornrow wigs down the catwalk at Paris Fashion Week?

China is battling to contain a highly infectious coronavirus that has killed at least 17 people and sickened hundreds. At least one case has been diagnosed in the US. In what animal do scientists and authorities think this virus originated?
qa_2020.evidence: Scientists believe the virus was first transmitted to humans via two species of venomous snakes sold in some traditional Chinese markets.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The New York Times made history this week by endorsing these two Democratic presidential candidates.
qa_2020.evidence: The New York times endorsed the two remaining major female candidates; Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which country finally formed a new government after the former prime minister stepped down in October amid ongoing protests over government corruption and economic hardship?
qa_2020.evidence: Hassan Diab, a former professor, was named Lebanon’s new prime minister. Diab will choose a new cabinet and attempt to move the country forward from months of unrest.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which two teams will play in this year’s Super Bowl?
choices: The San Francisco 49ers and the Kansas City Chiefs
The Green Bay Packers and the Kansas City Chiefs
The New England Patriots and the Green Bay Packers
The Baltimore Ravens and the San Francisco 49ers
qa_2020.evidence: The San Francisco 49ers and the Kansas City Chiefs will meet in Super Bowl LIV in Miami.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Protesters in Puerto Rico are demanding the resignation of Governor Wanda Vázquez after the what controversial discovery?
choices: A warehouse full of hurricane relief supplies
A secret deal with an electrical company
qa_2020.evidence: Vázquez fired several members of her cabinet after the discovery of a warehouse filled with supplies meant to be distributed after Hurricane Maria in 2017. Now, protesters want her ousted, too.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which popular fast food chain filed for bankruptcy this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Krystal said stiff competition and changing consumer tastes contributed to the chain’s decision.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Chief Justice John Roberts had to scold both sides during preliminary procedures in this week’s impeachment trial. He used an unusual word while doing so: Pettifogging. What does it mean?
choices: Stalling to keep something from happening
qa_2020.evidence: Pettifogging means “worrying too much about details that are minor or not important." Roberts used the word to refer to a complaint made during a 1905 trial. He was trying to say that people used to hold others to a higher standard of trial conduct, and so should the participants of the impeachment trial.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are settling into their new home in what country?
qa_2020.evidence: Markle lived in Canada for seven years prior to meeting Prince Harry, and the pair say they have a strong connection to the country.

qa_2020.question_sentence: President Trump traveled to Davos, Switzerland this week to participate in what important global gathering?
qa_2020.evidence: This year’s World Economic Forum focused on the climate crisis. In an address at the forum, Trump touted the strength of the American economy and urged optimism over a specific climate crisis action plan.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Social media is mourning the apparent death of what legendary brand mascot?
qa_2020.evidence: Planters announced the death of their 104-year-old mascot as part of their Super Bowl marketing plan. Mourners are urged to tune into the Super Bowl to get the full story on what happened to the beloved legume.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Who won the Nevada Democratic Party caucuses?
qa_2020.evidence: The results show Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders with a wide 26.6% margin of county delegates over former Vice President Joe Biden, who held a decisive second place position with 20.2%. qa_2020.question_sentence: Which women's tennis star announced her retirement this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Sharapova retired at the age of 32, having last won a grand slam in 2014 when she clinched the French Open for the second time. Her most recent appearance came at the 2020 Australian Open, where she was knocked out in the first round by Donna Vekić.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The world's oldest living man passed away this week. How old was he?
qa_2020.evidence: Chitetsu Watanabe, who lived at a nursing home in Niigata, Japan, was born on March 5th, 1907. He was officially confirmed by the Guinness World Record as the oldest living man on February 12 this year, before his death on Sunday, February 23.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which European country has the highest number of coronavirus infections outside of Asia?
qa_2020.evidence: The Head of Italian Civil Protection Angelo Borelli announced on Thursday evening that 650 people have tested positive for Coronavirus in Italy. At least 14 people have died.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The CEO of which major entertainment company stepped down from his role this week?
qa_2020.evidence: Bob Iger stepped down as CEO of the Walt Disney Company (DIS), effective immediately. Bob Chapek is the new CEO, the board of directors announced. He most recently served as chairman of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products.

qa_2020.question_sentence: TSA banned employee use of which popular social media platform?
qa_2020.evidence: TSA banned employee use of TikTok, as the US questions whether the China-owned app poses a threat to national security.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Multiple people were killed in a shooting Wednesday in which US city?
qa_2020.evidence: Mayor Tom Barrett told reporters that several people, including the shooter, have died. "It's a horrible, horrible day for the employees here," Barrett said. "It's a very rough day for anybody who's close to this situation."

qa_2020.question_sentence: The Hot Pockets heiress was sentenced to how long in prison for her involvement in the college admissions scam?
qa_2020.evidence: Former food company executive Michelle Janavs was sentenced Tuesday to five months in prison for paying bribes in the college admissions scam, the US Attorney's Office in Massachusetts said.

qa_2020.question_sentence: At least 21 people have been killed and 188 injured in two days of violent clashes in which Asian city over a new citizenship law?
qa_2020.evidence: The unrest erupted Monday in parts of the Indian capital between hundreds of supporters and opponents of a new law that fast-tracks citizenship for non-Muslim minorities from select countries.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Health officials are worried that the Wuhan coronavirus might be able to be spread in what unexpected way?
qa_2020.evidence: Officials are testing to see whether the coronavirus is spreading through pipes and drains after two people on different floors of a building were sickened. Such transmission became an issue during the SARS outbreak in the early 2000s.

qa_2020.evidence: Technically, consenting sex outside of marriage is illegal in Virginia, but lawmakers are hoping to change that soon once and for all.

Sending astronauts back to the moon

qa_2020.question_sentence: The BBC is opening an internal investigation into a 1995 interview allegedly conducted under false pretenses. Who was the subject of the interview?
qa_2020.evidence: Princess Diana was interviewed in 1995 by BBC journalist Martin Bashir, during which she admitted to problems in her marriage with Prince Charles. qa_2020.question_sentence: Chuck Yeager died this week at the age of 97. What did he do to make history?
choices: First American to enter Earth’s orbit
First to break the sound barrier
First pilot to circumnavigate the globe
qa_2020.evidence: Yeager, a WWII veteran and former US Air Force officer, was the first to break the sound barrier as a test pilot of the X-1. Although he reached the milestone in 1947, it was not announced until 1948.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The first doses of the Covid-19 vaccine were administered to the public this week in what country?
qa_2020.evidence: The United Kingdom became the first Western country to administer the Covid-19 vaccine, with the first doses going to 90-year-old Margaret Keenan.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Who did President-elect Joe Biden pick to be his secretary of defense?
qa_2020.evidence: Biden picked retired Army Gen. Lloyd Austin, the former commander of US Central Command. If confirmed, Austin would be the first Black defense secretary in US history.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Nepal and which other country, after more than a decade of dispute, have finally agreed on the actual height of Mount Everest?
qa_2020.evidence: Nepal and China have finally agreed upon the mountain’s height, with officials from both countries saying it stands at about 29,032 feet – less than a meter higher than previously recognized.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Which government program is now fully operational again after a federal judge ordered that it be continued?
qa_2020.evidence: Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, otherwise known as DACA, was ordered to be restored by a federal judge – an initiative the Trump administration long fought to dismantle.  Renewals and new applications alike will now be accepted, opening opportunities for thousands of young undocumented immigrants.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Apple announced December 14 as the launch date of its latest subscription service. What’s the service’s focus?
qa_2020.evidence: Apple is launching Fitness+, a subscription service that will feature on-demand video workouts, compatible with metrics the company says will be tracked by its Apple Watch.

qa_2020.question_sentence: What person or group was named Time’s Person of the Year for 2020?
qa_2020.evidence: President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris were named Time’s Person of the Year for “changing the American story,” said Time editor-in-chief Edward Felsenthal.

qa_2020.question_sentence: A crowdsourced musical adaptation of this Disney-Pixar movie gained so much attention on the video-sharing app TikTok that it’s now being made into a real Broadway fundraiser.
qa_2020.evidence: Details are still hazy, but the limited-time special will feature Broadway actors singing “Ratatouille”-themed music to benefit out-of-work performers.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Pantone announced two colors of the year for 2021. What are they?
qa_2020.evidence: Ultimate Gray and Illuminating are “a combination that speaks to the resilience, the optimism and hope and positivity that we need, as we reset, renew, reimagine and reinvent,” said Laurie Pressman, vice president of the Pantone Color Institute.

Continue receiving public funds in the UK
Keep their royal residence in Windsor
qa_2020.evidence: Part of Harry and Meghan becoming financially independent means they will no longer recieve public funding. However, they could still be supported in some way by Harry's father, Prince Charles.

Rage Against the Machine, Travis Scott and Frank Ocean

qa_2020.evidence: Thought 2016 was the hottest recorded year overall, 2019 was the hottest year for several parts of the world, like Europe and Australia.

qa_2020.evidence: This is the second time in a row The Oscars ceremony will be held without a host.

qa_2020.question_sentence: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell announced he and his fellow GOP Senators are going to press on with planning the upcoming impeachment trial, even without Democratic support. Overall, the aim of GOP Senators is for the trial to…
choices: Drag on indefinitely so the public loses interest
Wrap up quickly so they can put the whole thing behind them
Be cancelled so they don’t have to deal with it at all
Be delayed as long as possible so they can strategize
qa_2020.evidence: McConnell has made it clear he and his fellow Republicans want a quick trial so President Trump can be acquitted without any unnecessary disruptions.

qa_2020.question_sentence: The American Cancer Society announced that cancer death rates experienced the largest one-year drop ever between 2016 and 2017. Part of this was because of a large drop in deaths due to this type of cancer, which is the leading cause of cancer deaths in the US.
qa_2020.evidence: Researchers say the new data shows that advanced treatments for the disease are actually working.

qa_2023.question_sentence: NFL player Damar Hamlin suffered an on-field medical emergency this week. He is a valued member of which team?
qa_2023.evidence: The 24-year-old Buffalo Bills player has shown “remarkable improvement” after suffering a cardiac arrest during Monday night’s football game, his team said in a statement Thursday. Players, coaches and fans across the NFL community are keeping their focus on his recovery.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which former pope was laid to rest this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Pope Francis paid tribute this week to his predecessor, former Pope Benedict XVI, in a funeral attended by tens of thousands of mourners at St. Peter’s Square. Benedict, the first pontiff in almost 600 years to resign his position rather than hold office for life, died at age 95 on December 31 at a monastery in Vatican City.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which seed did the FDA recently add to its list of major food allergens?
qa_2023.evidence: Sesame joined the list of major food allergens defined by law, meaning foods containing sesame will be subject to new labeling and manufacturing requirements. For several years, the FDA has been reviewing whether to put sesame seeds on the major food allergens list — which also includes milk, eggs, fish, crustacean shellfish, tree nuts, peanuts, wheat and soybeans.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Huge crowds lined the streets of which country this week to pay tribute to soccer great Pelé?
qa_2023.evidence: Hundreds of thousands of people poured in the city of Santos, Brazil, to view Pelé’s funeral procession this week. The three-time World Cup winner died last month at the age of 82 due to the progression of colon cancer.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which airline announced it will give 25,000 frequent flier miles to passengers who were impacted by its holiday travel meltdown?
qa_2023.evidence: Some Southwest passengers who were affected by a wave of cancellations over the holidays are now receiving thousands of frequent flier miles as a “gesture of goodwill,” the company said.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which Covid-19 variant of Omicron has become the most dominant in the US, causing the most new coronavirus cases?
qa_2023.evidence: Scientists have been monitoring a rise in several Omicron subvariants, but XBB.1.5 cases have shown the greatest spike, rising from about 4% to 41% of new infections over the month of December.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A bomb cyclone is slamming California this week, causing widespread flooding. Which part of the state is experiencing the storm’s heaviest rain?
qa_2023.evidence: The storm’s heaviest rain and strongest winds have wreaked havoc in the Bay Area just days after a different storm brought deadly floods.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which company is the latest tech giant to announce significant layoffs?
qa_2023.evidence: Amazon plans to lay off more than 18,000 employees as the global economic outlook continues to worsen, the company announced this week.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The Republican Party has been at odds this week over who should become the next House speaker. Which GOP leader sparked a dayslong stalemate?
qa_2023.evidence: House Republicans disagreed for days over electing a speaker, with GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failing to secure the necessary support after multiple rounds of voting.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which home goods chain recently said it has “substantial doubt” it can stay in business?
qa_2023.evidence: Bed Bath & Beyond recently issued a warning that a bankruptcy filing is a possible outcome for the company. There is “substantial doubt about the company’s ability to continue” because of its worsening financial situation, the home goods chain said in a regulatory filing Thursday.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Prince Harry reportedly claims in his upcoming memoir Spare that his brother William did what during a row about Meghan Markle?
