qa_2023.question_sentence: The recently deceased Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI was the first pope to resign from the role in how many centuries?
qa_2023.evidence: Benedict died last week at the age of 95, almost a decade after resigning because of ill health. He became the first pope to stand down since Gregory XII in 1415

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which virus is England set to eradicate almost five years ahead of a target set by the World Health Organization (WHO)?
qa_2023.evidence: The NHS is on track to eliminate the virus in the community by 2025. Targeted screening campaigns and effective drug treatments have reduced the number of deaths from Hepatitis C by 35% in the past five years

qa_2023.question_sentence: Japan’s government is to offer families how much to relocate from Tokyo to less densely populated areas?
qa_2023.evidence: Parents in the Japanese capital can already claim 300,000 yen (£1,900) per child to relocate, but the subsidy is set to triple from April. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

qa_2023.question_sentence: The value of which tech giant fell below $2tn this week after shares dropped by as much as 4.3%?
qa_2023.evidence: Mounting concerns over Apple’s global supply chain and a wider sell-off in America left the company’s value at $1.98tn, down from a peak of $3tn at the start of 2022

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which US state is represented by congressman Kevin McCarthy, the Republican leader whose bid to be voted House speaker was blocked by GOP hardliners this week?
qa_2023.evidence: McCarthy became the first majority leader in 100 years to lose an initial vote to be elected speaker of the House of Representatives, and suffered further defeats in a series of ballots after failing to win over Republican rebels

qa_2023.question_sentence: Who has returned to TV screens in the role of Sergeant Catherine Cawood in hit BBC series Happy Valley?
qa_2023.evidence: The third and final season of the popular crime drama debuted this week, seven years after the second season concluded

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which climate action group has announced plans to ‘quit’ in 2023?
qa_2023.evidence: The climate action group released a statement on New Year’s Day titled ‘We Quit’. The activists plan to temporarily shift away from public disruption and focus on building a wider movement

qa_2023.question_sentence: Newly released figures show that the amount of electricity produced by which type of renewable energy hit a record high in Britain last year?
qa_2023.evidence: The National Grid said that on a single day in November, more than 70% of electricity in Britain was produced by wind – ‘enough power to heat about 1700 homes for a year’,  the BBC reported

qa_2023.question_sentence: Prince Harry and Meghan’s daughter will be known by which royal title?
qa_2023.evidence: The daughter of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex will go by the title of Princess Lilibet Diana, a spokesperson for the couple said following news of the child’s christening. This marks the first time the title of princess has been used publicly for Harry and Meghan’s daughter.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Senators unveiled a bipartisan bill this week empowering President Joe Biden to ban which popular app nationwide?
qa_2023.evidence: The legislation expands Biden’s legal authority to ban TikTok nationwide, marking the latest in a string of congressional proposals threatening the social media platform’s future in the US.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Millions of people in India and around the world are celebrating which holiday this week?
qa_2023.evidence: The Hindu festival known as Holi is being celebrated this week with signature traditions, including the throwing of colored powders.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which state rejected a ballot measure this week that would have legalized recreational marijuana?
qa_2023.evidence: Voters in Oklahoma rejected a measure that would have legalized recreational marijuana in the state for adults ages 21 and older. Similar measures in November failed in Arkansas, North Dakota and South Dakota, while voters in Maryland and Missouri approved recreational cannabis use.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Approximately how many troops does the US maintain in Syria as part of its campaign to defeat ISIS?
qa_2023.evidence: There are about 900 troops in Syria fighting against ISIS. A top US official visited them this week to check in and inspect force protection measures.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which comedian is set to host the 2023 Academy Awards Sunday night?
qa_2023.evidence: Jimmy Kimmel is set to take the Oscars stage as the host for the third time — one year after Will Smith infamously slapped presenter Chris Rock.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Amid violent clashes with police, dozens of people were detained this week in which country near Russia?
qa_2023.evidence: Tens of thousands of people gathered outside the Georgian parliament for demonstrations over a controversial “foreign influence” bill.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which network aired false depictions of the January 6, 2021, attack this week, drawing widespread criticism for misleading its audience?
qa_2023.evidence: The White House lashed out at Fox News host Tucker Carlson in an extraordinary rebuke of the commentator who has been airing false depictions of the Capitol insurrection this week. Carlson has aired carefully selected clips to portray the pro-Trump mob as peaceful patriots.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Large parts of which state were under emergency warnings due to recent storms and this week’s severe weather?
qa_2023.evidence: Millions across central and Northern California are grappling with a major storm system, with heavy rain threatening to cause widespread flooding in areas already dealing with dayslong snowfall.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Professional baseball player Justin Turner was hit by a fastball during a game this week, resulting in 16 stitches to the face. Which team does he play for?
qa_2023.evidence: The Boston Red Sox third baseman is resting at home after he was hit in the face by a pitch, his family said in a statement.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Syracuse men’s basketball coach Jim Boheim retired this week after 47 years at the helm. How many times did he lead his team to the Final Four?
Merlin Entertainments announced a theme park based on what children’s show will open in Texas in 2024?
California Gov. Gavin Newsom said the state won’t be doing business with which pharmacy chain?
The arrival carpet at this Sunday’s Oscars will not be its usual red. What color will it be?
Scientists recently revived a “zombie” virus that they say spent nearly 50,000 years:
NASA says an asteroid could hit Earth on what holiday in 2046?
Which team won’t be going to the NCAA men’s basketball tournament, despite being winning its regular season and conference tournament titles?
Ford released an ad highlighting women’s contributions to the auto industry featuring its Expedition model called:
Former President Donald Trump will be selling a book featuring:
choices: A compilation of letters celebrities wrote him
Never-before-seen photos of the White House
A collection of poems he wrote

qa_2023.question_sentence: Donald Trump’s 2024 pitch includes a promise to do what?
choices: Slash taxes for the middle class
qa_2023.evidence: Trump told supporters this week that he could settle the Russia-Ukraine war in “one day”. Speaking at the Conservative Political Action Conference in Maryland, he added: “I am the only candidate who can make this promise: I will prevent – and very easily – World War Three.”

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which US state is considering exonerating accused witches?
qa_2023.evidence: The state judiciary is considering the move after hearing testimony about a House Joint Resolution that would exonerate the total 34 people accused of witchcraft in colonial Connecticut between 1647 and1697, of whom 11 were executed.

qa_2023.question_sentence: TV producers feared which broadcaster would catch avian flu while filming his latest series?
qa_2023.evidence: The 96-year-old broadcaster was due to get up close to shearwater chicks on Skomer Island, off the coast of Wales, for his documentary Wild Isles, which debuts on BBC One and iPlayer this Sunday. But the plan was abandoned following reports of a bird flu outbreak on a neighbouring island.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which of the following items of clothing has reportedly become the latest status symbol for men “of a certain position”?
qa_2023.evidence: According to The Guardian, high-profile fans of quarter-zip jumpers – polo necks with a zip that runs from neck to chest –  include Rishi Sunak, David Beckham and Prince Harry, as a growing number of men “ditch the shirt and tie aesthetic”. John Lewis has sold 62% more quarter-zips than crewnecks since the start of the year.

qa_2023.question_sentence: TikTok is being credited with boosting sales of what genre of novel?
qa_2023.evidence: Sales of romantic fiction novels have risen by 110% in three years to an annual total of £53m, according to industry data. Publishers have attributed the rise in part to the #romancebooks hashtag on TikTok, which is the biggest sub-genre within the BookTok community, with billions of views.

qa_2023.question_sentence: What kind of alcohol is Brad Pitt’s co-owned brand Fleur de Miraval?
qa_2023.evidence: The actor’s champagne will be the official celebratory fizz at the Oscars on Sunday, for the second year in a row, after taking over from Piper-Heidsieck at the 2022 awards ceremony. Pitt’s bubbly, which costs around $400 a bottle, will also be served at the Governors Ball after-party.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which Premier League team suffered a 7-0 defeat by Liverpool a week after winning the Carabao Cup?
qa_2023.evidence: The Red Devils ended a six-year trophy drought by beating Newcastle 2-0 to win the Carabao Cup, but suffered their joint-biggest ever loss in a competitive game at Anfield on Sunday.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which country has shelved a new Russian-style “foreign agents law” following mass protests?
qa_2023.evidence: Thousands of people attended protests in capital Tbilisi earlier this week, after Georgia’s ruling party passed the initial reading of the bill. The now-ditched legislation would have required NGOs and media outlets funded from abroad to register as “agents of foreign influence” – a move that critics both at home and abroad warned threatened press freedom.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Who has reportedly moved into Frogmore Cottage following the eviction of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex?
qa_2023.evidence: Prince Andrew was initially expected to take over the royal residence, on the Windsor estate, after King Charles asked his youngest son to give up the property. But instead, Andrew’s youngest daughter has reportedly set up home there with her husband, Jack Brooksbank, and two-year-old son, August.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which English city is England’s pothole capital, according to a new analysis of local authority data?
qa_2023.evidence: Research by Compare the Market found that 78.5% of Bristol’s roads were damaged. The next-worst locations for potholes were Blackburn with Darwen (76%), Cheshire West and Chester (72%) and Derbyshire (71%).

qa_2023.question_sentence: US fighter jets recently shot down a suspected spy balloon off the East Coast. Which country did the balloon belong to?
qa_2023.evidence: US officials say they shot down a Chinese high-altitude balloon that was being used for surveillance. China, however, insists it was a civilian research vessel that drifted off course.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The 2023 Grammy Awards honored some of the world’s most talented musicians. Which artist won the show’s biggest prize, Album of the Year?
qa_2023.evidence: Harry Styles took home the award for Album of the Year at the Grammys for his hit album “Harry’s House.” See the full list of winners here.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which company unveiled a new AI chatbot tool dubbed “Bard” in an apparent bid to compete with the viral success of ChatGPT?
qa_2023.evidence: Google unveiled Bard earlier this week. The debut comes shortly after a spike in popularity for ChatGPT, an artificial intelligence tool that has been used to generate essays, song lyrics and responses to questions.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Search and rescue efforts continue in Turkey and Syria after a devastating earthquake this week. What was the magnitude of the quake that struck the region?
qa_2023.evidence: A 7.8 magnitude quake hit just after 4 a.m. local time on Monday, sending tremors hundreds of miles and creating disaster zones on both sides of the Turkey-Syria border.

qa_2023.question_sentence: AMC Theaters, America’s largest movie chain, announced its ticket prices will soon be based on seat location. Where will the most expensive seats in the theaters be located?
qa_2023.evidence: Seats in the front will be cheaper while more desirable seats in the middle will cost the most, according to a statement from AMC.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Who delivered the State of the Union address on Tuesday?
qa_2023.evidence: In his second State of the Union address, President Biden sought to connect with Americans by addressing various issues impacting the middle class. Health care and the economy were a large focus of his speech, as he set the stage for an expected 2024 reelection bid.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which athlete became the NBA’s all-time leading scorer this week?
qa_2023.evidence: LeBron James became the NBA’s all-time leading scorer on Tuesday, surpassing the record held by six-time NBA MVP Kareem Abdul-Jabbar for 39 years.

qa_2023.question_sentence: About 5 million bottles of which brand of multi-purpose cleaner was recalled this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Millions of bottles of Fabuloso multi-purpose cleaner have been voluntarily recalled because there’s a “risk of bacterial growth,” the company said.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which planet has the most moons in the solar system after a new discovery?
qa_2023.evidence: Astronomers have observed 12 additional moons orbiting Jupiter, bringing its total number of confirmed moons to 92. Saturn has 83 moons, Uranus has 27 moons and Earth has 1.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which company recently reported its “strongest quarter ever” while the rest of Silicon Valley stalls?
qa_2023.evidence: Uber on Wednesday reported substantial revenue growth in the final three months of last year, defying a slowdown that has pummeled much of the rest of the tech sector.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Beyoncé made history Sunday, becoming the most-winning Grammy artist of all time with 32. When did she win her first Grammy award?
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy made his second known trip outside Ukraine since Russia's invasion this week. Where did he go?
A Chinese balloon, which Pentagon officials said was built to spy on sensitive military sites, was shot down off the coast of which state?
Which movie theater chain announced plans to price tickets based on seat location within the auditorium?
LeBron James became the NBA’s all-time leading scorer this week. All of these players also rank in the top 5 in career points, except:
Which of these musicians was in attendance at President Joe Biden’s State of the Union address this week?
In a House Oversight Committee hearing investigating President Biden and his family, former Twitter executives were questioned about what?
choices: Media coverage of Hunter Biden’s laptop
Messages between Elon Musk and the Bidens

qa_2023.question_sentence: In Chick-fil-A's new plant-forward sandwich, what vegetable replaces the chicken?
NBA superstar Kevin Durant is headed to which team after the Brooklyn Nets traded the former MVP?
The number of new podcasts has dropped by how much in the past two years, according to latest data?
qa_2023.evidence: New research from Chartr reveals that despite continuing high demand, only 219,000 new shows debuted last year, down from 1,109,000 in 2020. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

qa_2023.question_sentence: An episode of which cartoon that referenced Chinese labour camps was pulled from Disney’s Hong Kong streaming service?
qa_2023.evidence: The episode, titled One Angry Lisa, was removed from Disney+ in Hong Kong amid growing concern about censorship in the Chinese territory.

qa_2023.question_sentence: New research suggests that the ingredients in which alcoholic drink can help keep skin healthy?
qa_2023.evidence: Researchers from Robert Gordon University in Aberdeen found that pot ale residue from the whisky-making process can provide antioxidant benefits in skincare.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Birmingham Royal Ballet is to stage a new ballet about which heavy metal band?
qa_2023.evidence: Black Sabbath are “probably Birmingham’s biggest export”, according to director Carlos Acosta, whose new ballet will feature eight tracks by the rockers.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which Tom Jones ballad has been banned from Welsh rugby stadiums?
qa_2023.evidence: The song has been an unofficial match-day anthem for decades but has now been vetoed by Welsh Rugby Union because the lyrics, about a man stabbing his unfaithful lover, are “problematic”.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which national newspaper claimed on its front page that ‘now even God could be going gender neutral’?
qa_2023.evidence: Church of England leaders are reportedly considering whether to stop referring to God as “He”, “Him” and “Father” in prayers and church services, amid growing calls for clergy to be allowed to use gender-neutral terms.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which pop star has become the most awarded singer in Grammy history by bagging 32 wins?
qa_2023.evidence: Beyoncé won Best Dance/Electronic Music Album with Renaissance, but missed out on the top prize, Album of the Year, which went to Harry Styles for Harry’s House.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Tory MP Lee Anderson kicked off his reign as the party’s new vice-chair after calling for what?
qa_2023.evidence: Days before his appointment as vice-chair was announced, the Ashford MP told The Spectator that he supports the return of the death penalty because “nobody has ever committed a crime after being executed”.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which classic British television comedy is to be revived?
qa_2023.evidence: John Cleese will write and star alongside his daughter Camilla in the reboot of the show, which ended in 1979.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A botched demonstration of Google’s new Bard chatbot wiped how much off parent company Alphabet’s market value?
qa_2023.evidence: An error during Google’s demonstration of its new rival to Microsoft’s ChatGPT instantly wiped 9% off the tech firm’s value.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which NFL teams are headed to the Super Bowl on February 12?
qa_2023.evidence: The Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs will face off in Super Bowl LVII.

qa_2023.question_sentence: President Joe Biden intends to end the Covid-19 national and public health emergencies in which month of this year?
qa_2023.evidence: Biden intends to end the Covid-19 national and public health emergencies on May 11, the White House said Monday. That means that many Americans could have to start paying for Covid-19 testing and treatment after the declarations cease.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which state has been bearing the brunt of a dangerous ice storm this week?
qa_2023.evidence: A combination of treacherous wintry conditions in Texas caused power outages for more than 400,000 homes and businesses, according to PowerOutage.US.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A record $3.8 billion worth of cryptocurrency was stolen from various services last year. Some of the biggest thefts were driven by hackers linked to which country?
qa_2023.evidence: Some of the biggest crypto thefts were driven by North Korean-linked hackers, according to a new report. US officials worry Pyongyang will use money stolen from crypto hacks to fund its illicit nuclear and ballistic weapons program.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Beloved actress Cindy Williams died this week at age 75. She was best known for her role on which popular sitcom?
qa_2023.evidence: Cindy Williams was a dynamic actress known best for playing Shirley Feeney on “Laverne & Shirley.”

qa_2023.question_sentence: A tiny radioactive capsule was found in which country this week following a frantic search?
qa_2023.evidence: Search teams found a missing radioactive capsule, no bigger than a coin, along a road in Western Australia on Wednesday.

qa_2023.question_sentence: What is approximately the average age of a first-time mother in the US?
qa_2023.evidence: The average age of a first-time mother in the US climbed above 27 years – marking a record high – in 2021, according to a CDC report. Birth rates increased among women ages 25 to 44, while the teen birth rate reached a record low.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A NASA orbiter recently captured craters and formations on Mars that resembled the face of which animal?
qa_2023.evidence: The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter used its high-resolution camera to capture craters and formations that resembled a bear’s face on Mars.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Workers brought which major city to a standstill this week following a second mass strike over pension reforms?
qa_2023.evidence: French schools and transportation networks were heavily disrupted Tuesday for the second time this month as unions staged another mass strike against government plans to raise the retirement age for most workers.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which music superstar announced she will soon embark on a global tour?
qa_2023.evidence: Beyoncé announced her eagerly awaited “Renaissance World Tour” is coming.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Tom Brady said he is ‘retiring for good’ this week. How many seasons did he play in the NFL?
Genetic engineering company Colossal announced this week that it wants to bring which species back to life?
This Republican is set to be the first to announce a challenge to former President Donald Trump in the next GOP presidential primary.
Dr. Carter G. Woodson, who helped develop Black History Month in the 1920s, was the second African American to earn a Ph.D from which university?
Former WNBA MVP Breanna Stewart became one of the latest stars to switch teams. Who will she play for next season?
Which of these was one of the committees Rep. George Santos resigned from this week?
Although the Federal Reserve eased its aggressiveness in beating back price increases, it still raised its key short-term interest rate by how much?
Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce fired back at Cincinnati Mayor Aftab Pureval after beating the Cincinnati Bengals, by borrowing a phrase from which wrestler?
Actress Cindy Williams, who played Shirley in the hit show ‘Laverne & Shirley,’ died at 75. She also appeared in which of these films?
A Chinese food blogger was fined the equivalent of £15,000 for eating which sea creature?
qa_2023.evidence: Police began investigating after the blogger, known as Tizi to her almost eight million followers, posted footage on Chinese social media site Douyin last year showing her illegally buying and then cooking the endangered shark.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Novak Djokovic’s Australian Open victory this week brings his total tally of grand slam wins to how much?
qa_2023.evidence: The 35-year-old tennis player is now level with rival Rafael Nadal on 22 grand slam titles, and is once again No.1 in the ATP world rankings.

qa_2023.question_sentence: YouTube legend MrBeast is facing criticism for doing what in his latest online stunt?
choices: Paying for 1,000 people to have cataract removal surgery
Cooking a three-course meal of roadkill for friends
Organising a mass wedding in Las Vegas
qa_2023.evidence: The YouTuber, real name Jimmy Donaldson, has been accused of “charity porn” after posting a now-viral video documenting how he paid for life-changing operations for people blinded by the condition.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which film star is at the centre of a “race row” after being nominated for Best Actress at the upcoming Oscars?
qa_2023.evidence: The British actor is up for the gong for her role in To Leslie following a celebrity-backed campaign, but has become the focal point of an ongoing row about racism in Hollywood as critics point to the lack of black nominees.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which “sleepy” town is the UK’s capital for Satanists, according to latest census data?
qa_2023.evidence: The 2021 census found that 70 out of around 8,500 people living in Bungay and nearby villages identified as devil-worshippers – more than a hundred times the national average.

qa_2023.question_sentence: An independent review found that “too many” of which broadcaster’s journalists “lack understanding of basic economics”?
qa_2023.evidence: In a BBC-commissioned report on its coverage of government financial policies, economic experts Michael Blastland and Andrew Dilnot warned that impartiality was “at risk” because some of the broadcaster’s journalists “make assumptions and have gaps in their knowledge”.

qa_2023.question_sentence: New research found that which UK coffee chain brews up the most caffeine-packed cappuccinos?
qa_2023.evidence: According to a Which? analysis, a medium cappuccino from Costa contains a “massive” 325mg of caffeine – almost five times more than the Starbucks version, with 66mg. Pret a Manger has the strongest espresso, with 180mg per shot.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which billionaire has fallen off Forbes’s top ten rich list following fraud allegations?
qa_2023.evidence: A New York-based research group has accused the Indian industrialist’s Adani Group of “brazen stock manipulation and accounting fraud” that amounted to “the largest con in corporate history”.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which energy giant has announced the highest profit in its 115-year history?
qa_2023.evidence: The British multinational oil and gas company has recorded an annual profit of  $40bn (£32bn) after energy prices surged following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A Jewish family is suing the Guggenheim over a painting by which artist that was allegedly sold under duress during Nazi rule?
qa_2023.evidence: Picasso’s Woman Ironing was bequeathed to the New York museum decades after being sold at a cut-price by Jewish art dealer Karl Adler in order to fund his family’s escape from Nazi Germany. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which state has been drenched by a powerful storm this week, causing widespread flooding and power outages?
qa_2023.evidence: Back-to-back atmospheric rivers in California have dropped staggering amounts of rain on the state and left dozens of highways impassable.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which three-digit phone number is going out of service for millions of Americans?
qa_2023.evidence: Beginning this month, AT&T customers with digital landlines won’t be able to dial 411 or 0 to get directory assistance or reach an operator. The company is instead directing customers to find addresses and phone numbers on Google or online directories.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Prince Harry published his highly anticipated memoir this week detailing some controversial claims about the British royal family. What is the book titled?
qa_2023.evidence: Prince Harry set a record with his tell-all memoir “Spare,” after the English language version sold more than 1.4 million copies on its first day of publication. The book’s title “Spare” is a reference to “heir and a spare,” a saying in the UK that the Duke of Sussex’s role is seen as the monarchy’s “spare heir.”

qa_2023.question_sentence: About 7,000 people went on strike in New York City this week arguing that immense staffing shortages have caused widespread burnout. Where do the strikers work?
qa_2023.evidence: A nurses strike at two major hospital systems in the city came to an end Thursday after thousands of nurses spent three days on the picket line.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which political figure faced a barrage of questions this week after batches of classified documents were found in one of his former offices and in one of his homes?
qa_2023.evidence: President Joe Biden’s legal team found batches of classified government records that were incorrectly handled following his time as vice president. Classified documents are supposed to go to the National Archives when an administration ends.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which awards show aired this week on the heels of diversity and ethics controversies?
qa_2023.evidence: The Golden Globe Awards returned to TV this week after a series of controversies drove the ceremony off the air last year. See the full list of nominees and winners here.

qa_2023.question_sentence: For the first time in 50,000 years, a rare comet is making an appearance in the night sky this week. Which color is it?
qa_2023.evidence: A dazzling green comet is making a swing by Earth this week. The comet has been visible through binoculars for sky-watchers in the Northern Hemisphere.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A top consumer regulator set off a firestorm this week by suggesting there could be a large-scale ban on which type of home appliance?
qa_2023.evidence: Consumer Product Safety Commissioner Richard Trumka Jr. said federal safety regulators are considering a ban on gas stoves. Following public outcry and confusion, President Biden weighed in on the matter, with a spokesperson telling CNN: “The President does not support banning gas stoves – and the Consumer Product Safety Commission, which is independent, is not banning gas stoves.”

qa_2023.question_sentence: Several grocery items are getting more expensive in the US, but nothing comes close to the rising cost of which popular food?
qa_2023.evidence: US egg supplies are currently constrained due to a deadly avian flu that is causing widespread shortages. This is drastically pushing up egg costs worldwide.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which candy brand is facing criticism over one of its new packaging designs?
qa_2023.evidence: M&M’s is making a statement with its latest candy pack featuring an all-female set of characters. Some right-wing news networks, however, have expressed outrage about the design.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The Georgia Bulldogs romped past this opponent on Monday to win their second straight College Football Playoff championship.
Which Hollywood star was seen working at a Dunkin’ Donuts this week?
Hundreds of people were arrested in which country after government buildings in its capital city were attacked, vandalized and looted on Jan. 8?
At the North American Leaders’ Summit this week, President Joe Biden held bilateral talks with this leader, his Mexican counterpart:
About 100 Ukrainians will travel to which US state to learn how to use the Patriot missile defense system?
Who won the award for best actress in a musical or comedy at the Golden Globes this week?
All these MLB teams reportedly agreed to a contract with shortstop Carlos Correa this offseason except:
Burger chain In-N-Out announced this week it was expanding to which state?
Thousands of flights across the US were delayed Wednesday because of what at the Federal Aviation Administration?
The Mega Millions jackpot has increased to how much after no winner was announced on Tuesday?
According to UN-backed scientists, Earth’s ozone layer is on track to fully recover from human-made damage by when?
qa_2023.evidence: A new UN report predicts that our planet’s protective shield from the Sun’s harmful ultraviolet rays could recover to 1980s levels by 2066 over Antarctica, by 2045 over the Arctic and by 2040 over the rest of the world

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which three-Michelin-starred restaurant said to be the world’s best is closing because of ‘unsustainable’ economics?
qa_2023.evidence: Chef René Redzepi has helmed the Copenhagen restaurant since 2003 but said he would be forced to call it quits by the end of next year owing to soaring food and labour costs

qa_2023.question_sentence: New research found that MPs earned a total of how much from second jobs over the past three years?
qa_2023.evidence: According to the Westminster Accounts interactive database, launched by Sky News and Tortoise Media, around two-thirds of the extra earnings went to just 20 MPs, with Theresa May claiming the biggest share

qa_2023.question_sentence: Who won Best Director at the 2023 Golden Globes?
qa_2023.evidence: Spielberg’s semi-autobiographical film The Fabelmans was one of the big winners at this week’s awards ceremony, also bagging the Best Drama gong

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which high-profile billionaire has gained a place in the Guinness Book of World Records for ‘largest ever loss of personal wealth’?
qa_2023.evidence: Musk has reportedly lost $182bn since November 2021, largely owing to a steep drop in Tesla share prices. In December, he also lost his crown as the world’s richest person to Arnault, the boss of French fashion giant LVMH

qa_2023.question_sentence: Prince Harry’s memoir Spare broke sales records by selling how many copies in the UK on its release day?
qa_2023.evidence: Penguin Random House said the royal’s book sold more than 400,000 copies in the UK on Tuesday alone across hardback, ebook and audio formats, and around a million more in the US and Canada

qa_2023.question_sentence: Republican Kevin McCarthy was finally elected as speaker of the US House of Representatives after how many rounds of voting?
qa_2023.evidence: McCarthy was the first majority leader in a century to fail to be elected in the first ballot. He finally succeeded after making major concessions to ultra-conservative GOP lawmakers who had blocked his speaker bid

qa_2023.question_sentence: The UK’s first ever space mission failed after the Virgin Orbit rocket launched from where?
qa_2023.evidence: An ‘anomoly’ prevented Virgin Orbit’s LauncherOne rocket from blasting into orbit after lifting off from Newquay on Monday night under the arm of a modified jumbo jet

qa_2023.question_sentence: Around how many UK households are at risk of defaulting on their mortgages in the next two years, according to the nation’s financial regulator?
qa_2023.evidence: The Financial Conduct Authority said more than 200,000 households had already fallen behind on payments as of last June and a further 570,000 households were ‘at risk of payment shortfall’ within the next two years

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which Chinese city is set to offer cash incentives for residents to have more children?
qa_2023.evidence: Under plans aimed at reversing declining birth rates, the southern city’s 17.7m residents will be paid about £900 for starting a family, with additional payments of £1,300 and £2,300 respectively for second and third children

qa_2023.question_sentence: Where does the CDC want to test wastewater for possible coronavirus variants?
qa_2023.evidence: The CDC is ironing out the “logistical and legal” aspects of testing sewage from commercial airplanes. The agency believes airplane wastewater surveillance could help detect emerging Covid-19 and flu variants and help vaccine makers determine which variants our Covid-19 shots might need to target each year.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which film scored the most Oscar nominations this week?
qa_2023.evidence: The strange and sentimental film “Everything Everywhere All at Once” led among the contenders with 11 nominations. See the full list of nominees here.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The IRS started accepting 2022 federal income tax returns this week. When is the deadline to file your taxes this year?
qa_2023.evidence: You should file your taxes by April 18, according to the IRS. However, anyone can apply for – and will automatically be granted – a six-month extension until October 16 if the proper documentation is completed.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which country experienced a nationwide power outage this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Nearly 220 million people in Pakistan were without power after a countrywide outage.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which tech company is being sued over its alleged failure to pay rent on some of its offices?
qa_2023.evidence: Twitter is facing lawsuits over alleged unpaid rent. The company was most recently sued by UK’s Crown Estate, a property belonging to the British monarch which generates profits for public spending.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Communities across the US are being upended nearly every day due to gun violence. Which state was recently affected by two major back-to-back mass shootings this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Two California cities — Monterey Park and Half Moon Bay – are among the latest communities grieving following recent acts of gun violence.

qa_2023.question_sentence: More than 100,000 homes and businesses lost power this week across the Southern US due to which kind of severe weather event?
qa_2023.evidence: More than a dozen reported tornadoes struck communities in Texas and Louisiana, damaging power lines and causing widespread destruction.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Millions of people around the world are celebrating Lunar New Year this week. According to the Chinese zodiac calendar, 2023 is the year of which animal?
qa_2023.evidence: Lunar New Year, which fell on January 22, ushered in the Year of the Rabbit.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Classified documents were recently found at the home of which high-profile Republican?
qa_2023.evidence: About a dozen documents marked as classified were recently found at Former Vice President Mike Pence’s Indiana home in the wake of classified material discovered in President Joe Biden’s private office and residence. The representatives for former Presidents Bill Clinton, George W. Bush, Barack Obama and the late George H.W. Bush all told CNN this week that all classified records had been turned over to the National Archives upon leaving office.

qa_2023.question_sentence: In addition to the US, which country said it will send tanks to Ukraine following weeks of diplomatic pressure to do so?
qa_2023.evidence: The leaders of the US and Germany each announced Wednesday they will send tanks to Ukraine, reversing their longstanding trepidation at providing Kyiv with offensive armored vehicles and unleashing powerful new tools in Ukraine’s efforts to retake territory seized by Russia.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which candy brand announced it was putting its mascot characters on an ‘indefinite pause’ and replacing them with Maya Rudolph?
Which of these films received the most nominations for this year’s Oscars?
The Doomsday Clock moved to how many seconds to midnight?
Third baseman Scott Rolen was the lone player elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame this year. He played for five MLB teams, including the:
This past weekend, rapper Drake performed at which iconic venue?
Mikaela Shiffrin broke the world record for World Cup victories by a female Alpine skier, previously held by:
The newest Oreo cookie has which type of filling?
The iconic ‘Goonies’ home was recently sold to a fan of the film for $1.65 million. Which state is the house located in?
According to a recent study published in the journal Nature Geoscience, the Earth’s inner core may have:
Which film has bagged the most nominations for the upcoming Oscars awards?
qa_2023.evidence: The comedy-drama is up for 11 awards, including Best Picture and Best Director, at the 95th Academy Awards, which will take place on 12 March at Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles

qa_2023.question_sentence: Tory party chair Nadhim Zahawi has admitted settling a tax dispute with HMRC while he was serving as Chancellor under which prime minister?
qa_2023.evidence: Zahawi was Chancellor of the Exchequer from 5 July to 6 September 2022, during which time he reached a reported £5m settlement with the tax authorities after making what he claimed was an ‘innocent error’ in his financial affairs

qa_2023.question_sentence: The 2023 Lunar New Year rang in the year of which zodiac animal?
qa_2023.evidence: The Year of the Rabbit began on 22 January, when 15 days of worldwide celebrations kicked off. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

qa_2023.question_sentence: Beyoncé was reportedly paid how much to perform a one-hour show in Dubai last weekend?
qa_2023.evidence: The superstar singer is facing criticism from the LGBTQ+ community for accepting the gig at a hotel launch in the UAE, which has strict laws against homosexuality

qa_2023.question_sentence: Who interviewed Ghislaine Maxwell on TalkTV this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Speaking from a Florida prison, where she is serving 20 years for sex trafficking, Maxwell said she wished she had ‘never met’ her late paedophile partner Jeffrey Epstein

qa_2023.question_sentence: In what year did Scottish poet Robert Burns, whose birthday on 25 January is celebrated with Burns Night, write Address to A Haggis?
qa_2023.evidence: The poem, written ten years before his death, is traditionally recited as haggis is cut and served to guests at the Burns Night supper

qa_2023.question_sentence: What controversial solution has been proposed to reduce the growing population of carp in Australia?
qa_2023.evidence: The Australian government is considering using a carp herpes virus to cull the invasive species, but critics says further research is needed into how other types of fish might be impacted

qa_2023.question_sentence: Scientists this week set the hands of the Doomsday Clock to how many seconds before midnight?
qa_2023.evidence: The symbolic timepiece of how close the world is to destruction now stands at 90 seconds to midnight – closer than ever before – after being moved forward 10 seconds by experts from the Bulletin of Atomic Scientists

qa_2023.question_sentence: Kylie Jenner has angered animal rights activists by wearing a dress adorned with a lion’s head that was designed by who?
qa_2023.evidence: Jenner’s dress sparked uproar at Paris Fashion Week even though the  lion’s head was faux, with critics claiming the design and similar looks from the label’s latest collection promotes real-life ‘trophy hunting’

qa_2023.question_sentence: The upcoming release of a memoir by who reportedly threatens to ‘overshadow’ King Charles’s coronation?
qa_2023.evidence: Giuffre has reportedly signed a multimillion-dollar deal to publish her memoir, ahead of the expiration of a one-year gag order that formed part of her sex-abuse case settlement with Prince Andrew

qa_2023.question_sentence: Temperatures in the world’s coldest city plunged to -80 degrees Fahrenheit this week. Which city holds the title of the coldest?
qa_2023.evidence: The coldest city in the world is Yakutsk, Russia. Residents say they still manage to get outside for work and errands, even though temperatures have plunged to an unimaginable -80.9 degrees Fahrenheit.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which national holiday was celebrated this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Monday was Martin Luther King Jr. Day, a national holiday celebrating the birthday of the civil rights leader who won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A deadly plane crash recently occurred in which South Asian country?
qa_2023.evidence: Yeti Airlines flight 691 crashed in Nepal on January 15. There were 72 people on board, including four crew members, according to an airline spokesperson. With all but one body recovered, the crash marks the country’s deadliest air disaster in more than 30 years.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which major sports tournament is currently underway?
qa_2023.evidence: Tennis greats from around the world are facing off at the Australian Open. In a major upset this week, 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal was knocked out in the second round by American Mackenzie McDonald.

qa_2023.question_sentence: How many US states have taken action to restrict TikTok on government devices?
qa_2023.evidence: A total of 31 states have restricted TikTok on government devices. The accelerating backlash from both Republican and Democratic governors comes amid renewed security concerns about how the platform handles user data and fears that it could find its way to the Chinese government.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which major tech company announced 10,000 job cuts this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Microsoft is the latest tech company to reduce staff because of growing economic uncertainty. The job cuts represent about 5% of the company’s total workforce, according to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which professional sports team was invited to the White House this week?
qa_2023.evidence: President Joe Biden welcomed the Golden State Warriors back to the White House on Tuesday to celebrate their 2022 NBA championship.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which country’s prime minister unexpectedly announced that she will resign within weeks?
qa_2023.evidence: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announced that she will resign within weeks, saying she doesn’t believe she has the energy to seek reelection in the October polls.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which US state’s governor is pushing to permanently ban coronavirus vaccine mandates?
qa_2023.evidence: Amid rising Covid-19 cases across the US, Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis is pushing to permanently ban coronavirus vaccine and face mask mandates in his state. DeSantis, a vocal Covid-19 skeptic, also wants to prevent doctors from losing their medical licenses if they stake out positions that contradict medical consensus.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which superstar singer announced a new world tour this week?
qa_2023.evidence: Madonna fans were overjoyed about her new tour announcement this week, which according to her site, “will take us on Madonna’s artistic journey through four decades and pays respect to the city of New York where her career in music began.”

qa_2023.question_sentence: West Virginia announced an $87 million settlement with which company for its role in perpetuating the opioid crisis in the state?
Which tech company confirmed this week that it was laying off 10,000 of its employees?
Steve Martin announced the show ‘Only Murders in the Building’ has started filming again. Which actor is a new addition this upcoming season?
All of these stars will co-chair this year’s Met Gala with Vogue Editor-in-Chief Anna Wintour, except:
China’s birth rate declined for the first time in decades in 2022. It has been the world’s most populous nation since at least:
This four-time WNBA champion stepped away from basketball in 2018, but finally made her retirement official this week on "Good Morning America."
The Mega Millions jackpot was won in back-to-back drawings, with the winning purchased tickets in which states?
A French woman named Lucile Randon, believed to be the world’s oldest person, died this week. What age was she?
Brendan Fraser won the Critics Choice award for best actor this past weekend. He has starred in all of these movies except:
Italy’s No. 1 fugitive, convicted Mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro, was arrested Monday after how many years on the run?
A newly unveiled $10m sculpture in Boston honouring Martin Luther King Jr. was created by which US artist?
qa_2023.evidence: The sculpture, called The Embrace, was inspired by a photo of the civil rights activist hugging his wife, Coretta Scott King, but has been criticised as ‘obscene’ and ‘pornographic looking’

qa_2023.question_sentence: The chair of the Food Standards Agency warned this week that doing what was as harmful to health as passive smoking?
choices: Adding sugar to tea and coffee
qa_2023.evidence: Professor Susan Jebb warned against tempting colleagues with sweet treats, telling The Times that people ‘undervalue’ the impact of their environment on their eating choices

qa_2023.question_sentence: Residents of which European capital are to vote on whether to ban e-scooters?
qa_2023.evidence: Scheduled for 2 April, the public referendum follows thousands of crashes, some fatal, involving the electric vehicles in the French capital

qa_2023.question_sentence: Locals in the Spanish village San Bartolome de Pinares honour Saint Anthony every 16 January by doing what?
qa_2023.evidence: The tradition of riding horses through a string of bonfires in the village’s streets is a centuries-old purification ritual to ward off sickness

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which woodland creatures have returned to Hampshire for the first time in 400 years?
qa_2023.evidence: Beavers were hunted to extinction in England in the 16th century. But now a pair named Chompy and Hazel have been released into an enclosure at Ewhurst Park near Basingstoke, as part of a rewilding project

qa_2023.question_sentence: The UK government is racing to replace thousands of EU laws that will lapse when?
qa_2023.evidence: Rishi Sunak this week doubled down on the end-of-year deadline to repeal or replace around 4,000 pieces of legislation that were retained after Britain quit the bloc

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which UK religious group has reported a 200% increase in membership in the last five years?
qa_2023.evidence: Chaplain Leopold of the Global Order of Satan UK told The Sunday Telegraph that young people were embracing alternatives to ‘outdated’ and ‘dogmatic’ traditional religions

qa_2023.question_sentence: Tory MPs have reportedly been told not to use which Boris Johnson-era slogan?
qa_2023.evidence: Conservative MPs in key marginal seats told The Times they were being told to ditch the slogan in favour of alternatives because ‘no one knows what it means’

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which pop icon will embark on her 40th anniversary tour this year?
qa_2023.evidence: Marking the 40th anniversary of her breakout single Holiday, The Celebration Tour will start in Vancouver, in July, and finish in Amsterdam, in December

qa_2023.question_sentence: Jacinda Ardern has announced her resignation after serving as New Zealand’s prime minister since when?
qa_2023.evidence: Ardern said that after a ‘challenging’ five-and-a-half years, she no longer had ‘enough in the tank’ to continue as the country’s leader

qa_2023.question_sentence: SpaceX and NASA launched a fresh crew of astronauts on a mission to space this week. What is their destination?
qa_2023.evidence: The mission, called Crew-6, kicks off a trip to the International Space Station where astronauts will spend roughly six months carrying out science experiments and maintaining the two-decade-old station.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Advisers to the FDA this week voted to approve new vaccines for which virus?
qa_2023.evidence: Two new RSV vaccine candidates, made by Pfizer and GlaxoSmithKline, could become the world’s first approved shots against the common respiratory syncytial virus (RSV). The FDA, which typically follows the committee’s recommendations, is expected to decide on approval in May, ahead of RSV’s typical winter surge.

qa_2023.question_sentence: According to authorities, what was the primary cause of a fatal train collision in Greece this week?
qa_2023.evidence: The train collision was due to “tragic human error,” Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotaki said. Authorities have since arrested a station manager in connection with the collision that left dozens of people dead.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The Supreme Court took up two challenges this week concerning which of President Joe Biden’s key programs?
qa_2023.evidence: President Biden voiced clear concern this week that the Supreme Court may decide to strike down his student loan debt forgiveness program after several conservative justices expressed skepticism about the administration’s authority.

qa_2023.question_sentence: New York City received its biggest snowfall of the season this week. About how many inches were measured in Central Park?
qa_2023.evidence: Due to an unusually warm winter, New York City received only 1.8 inches of snow this week — and 2.2 inches of snow this entire winter season. It is the lowest seasonal snowfall on record and more than 2 feet below the seasonal average of just under 30 inches. Meanwhile, a storm system on the West Coast brought feet of snow and unusually cold temperatures this week.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The White House recently announced a 30-day deadline for federal agencies to remove which app from all government-issued devices?
qa_2023.evidence: Federal officials were instructed to remove TikTok from their government-issued devices within 30 days. This comes amid concerns that the Chinese government could pressure ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok, to hand over information collected from users that could be used for intelligence purposes.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Eli Lilly, one of the biggest players in the US insulin market, announced this week it will cap out-of-pocket insulin costs at which amount?
qa_2023.evidence: The major drugmaker said it will cap out-of-pocket insulin costs at $35 for many people with diabetes. “Insulin costs less than $10 to make, but Americans are sometimes forced to pay over $300 for it. It’s flat wrong,” President Biden said in a statement on Wednesday, calling the announcement “a big deal.”

qa_2023.question_sentence: According to a new study published this week, how many minutes of daily exercise could have a positive impact on your health?
qa_2023.evidence: A new study shows just 11 minutes of moderate-to-vigorous daily activity can lower your risk of cancer and cardiovascular diseases.

qa_2023.question_sentence: This week, mortgage rates in the US rose for the fourth consecutive week as inflation concerns remain. What is the current average rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage?
qa_2023.evidence: While rates had been trending downward after hitting 7.08% in November, current rates are now steadily increasing above 6%. This is causing home buyers to pull back even as the spring home buying season should be heating up.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which popular Netflix show will return as a stage play?
qa_2023.evidence: Fans bracing themselves to say goodbye to “Stranger Things” after its fifth and final season are getting excited that it will soon take on a new life as a London stage play.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which movie won for best ensemble cast at this past weekend’s Screen Actors Guild Awards?
Numerous newspapers, including the USA TODAY Network, announced it would drop which comic strip after its creator made racist remarks?
More than 300 new words were added to Dictionary.com this week. Which of these words is one of the new additions?
In an effort to speed up the pace of play, MLB is instituting new rules this season. The rules will prompt changes to all of these except:
Which former “Friends” cast member received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame during a ceremony this week?
Which famous action movie from the 1990s premiered this week as a rebooted weekly TV drama series on CBS?
Voters in Chicago went to the polls this week to elect a new mayor. Two candidates advanced to a runoff. Who didn’t?
Following her ouster from Congress last year, former Wyoming GOP Rep. Liz Cheney accepted job teaching at which university?
Power from zero-carbon sources made up a record-breaking __% of the US electricity mix in 2022, according to a new factbook.
UK ministers reportedly considered a nationwide cull of which household pets at the start of the Covid pandemic?
qa_2023.evidence: Former health minister James Bethnell told Channel 4 News this week that the government talked about whether “we might have to ask the public to exterminate all the cats in Britain”, because “we were very unclear about whether domestic pets could transmit the disease”.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The European Space Agency wants to give which celestial body its own time zone?
qa_2023.evidence: Announcing the joint international effort, the agency argued that “as dozens of missions will be operating on and around the Moon and needing to communicate together and fix their positions independently from Earth, this new era will require its own time”.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which popular energy drink is reportedly being traded on black markets at schools across the UK?
qa_2023.evidence: High demand for the drink, launched last year by YouTubers Logan Paul and KSI, has reportedly seen some children paying “dealers” many times more than the retail price of £2 per 500ml bottle.

qa_2023.question_sentence: What is the name of Rishi Sunak’s new Brexit deal with the European Union?
qa_2023.evidence: Sunak met European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Windsor on Monday to finalise the deal, which is designed to settle the long-running dispute between the UK and the EU over Northern Ireland trading arrangements.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Why has London’s Young Vic Theatre issued a trigger warning for audiences of its latest production?
choices: Cooked eggs are handled on stage
Peanut butter is eaten on stage
qa_2023.evidence: A notice on the theatre’s website warned that along with references to “sexual violence, mental illness, death and implied suicide”, the revival of Zinnie Harris’s Further than the Furthest Thing “involves the handling of cooked egg”. The theatre said the warning was for people with egg allergies.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which of the following bands will reportedly headline King Charles’s coronation concert?
qa_2023.evidence: Gary Barlow, Mark Owen and Howard Donald are said to have agreed to perform at the coronation bash in May. Kylie and Dannii Minogue and Lionel Richie are also reported to be on board, but Elton John, Harry Styles and Adele have turned down invitations owing to scheduling clashes.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which football team won the Carabao Cup final on Sunday?
qa_2023.evidence: The Red Devils secured a 2-0 victory over Newcastle United at Wembley stadium.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Florida’s Governor Ron DeSantis has taken control of Walt Disney World’s self-governing district after the corporation opposed which of his bills?
qa_2023.evidence: The Republican has signed a bill giving his state control over Disney’s Reedy Creek Improvement District – a move widely viewed as “punishment” after the entertainment giant last year protested against his law restricting sexual orientation discussion in schools.

qa_2023.question_sentence: What percentage of the world’s population will be obese by 2035 unless action is taken, according to a new report?
qa_2023.evidence: The World Obesity Federation predicts that more than 4bn people across the world will be obese or overweight within the next 12 years if current trends prevail.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Research for the BBC found that the average price of pasta has risen by how much in the past two years?
qa_2023.evidence: The cost of a standard 500g bag of pasta has increased from 50p to 95p, according to research firm Assosia. The analysis of 15 “everyday essentials” at Asda, Tesco, Morrisons and Sainsbury’s found that the overall cost had risen by 34%.

qa_2023.question_sentence: President Joe Biden made a highly secretive trip to which country this week?
qa_2023.evidence: President Joe Biden visited Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv, for the first time since Russia invaded the country. The trip was shrouded in secrecy due to security concerns.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Many people across the world celebrated Mardi Gras this week to mark the last day of Carnival season. In which city was the first Mardi Gras celebration held?
qa_2023.evidence: The first Mardi Gras celebration was held in 1703 in Mobile, Alabama.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A powerful aftershock struck southern Turkey on Monday – two weeks after an initial magnitude 7.8 earthquake killed more than 46,000. How strong was the aftershock?
qa_2023.evidence: A magnitude 6.3 aftershock on Monday killed at least six people and injured hundreds of others, reigniting panic in the region.

qa_2023.question_sentence: After spending nearly 10 months imprisoned in Russia, WNBA star Brittney Griner is making her return to basketball in the upcoming season. Which team will she play for?
qa_2023.evidence: Griner signed a one-year deal with the Phoenix Mercury, the team announced on Tuesday.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Starbucks is going out on a limb with the announcement of a new drink featuring which bold ingredient?
qa_2023.evidence: The coffee chain is rolling out a new line of beverages made with a spoonful of extra virgin olive oil.

qa_2023.question_sentence: The pandemic-era border restriction known as Title 42 is set to expire in which month?
qa_2023.evidence: Title 42, a rule that ensures federal officials will be able to continue to swiftly expel migrants at US borders, is set to expire in May. The Biden administration also released a new rule on Tuesday that largely bars migrants who traveled through other countries on their way to the US-Mexico border from applying for asylum in the US.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Thousands of US flights were disrupted this week by which type of weather event?
qa_2023.evidence: A coast-to-coast winter storm system with blizzard conditions and significant snowfall is hampering travel. Meanwhile, several other parts of the country are experiencing a summer-like heat that has never been felt before during the month of February.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Scientists say climate change-fueled water shortages may disrupt the distribution and cultivation of agave – a key ingredient of which beverage?
qa_2023.evidence: Tequila is being threatened by changing weather and a strain on the agave plant’s vital pollinator — the bat.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Approximately how much money did Donald Trump’s leadership PAC spend on legal services in 2022?
qa_2023.evidence: Trump’s leadership PAC spent more than $16 million on legal services in 2022. The number represents a massive set of bills from lawyers at a time when the former president faces multiple criminal inquiries, lawsuits and other challenges.

qa_2023.question_sentence: Which company said this week it will spend $1 billion this year to increase wages and other compensation for its employees?
qa_2023.evidence: Home Depot said it will increase pay and benefits for hourly workers by $1 billion this year, another sign of a tighter labor market and rising wages across the US economy.

qa_2023.question_sentence: A new bill filed in Florida would prohibit dogs from:
choices: Extending their heads out of car windows
Going to the bathroom on private property
Staying in outdoor dog houses past 10 p.m.
Living in shelters for longer than 30 days

qa_2023.question_sentence: Netflix announced a new series with NFL Films called "Quarterback" that will feature all these signal callers except:
Dr. Seuss Enterprises and Penguin Random House Children's Book announced which famous Seuss book will get a sequel?
Vivek Ramaswamy, biotech entrepreneur and author from Ohio, entered the Republican presidential primary race. He wrote a book titled:
Democrat Jennifer McClellan made history this week in a special election, becoming the first Black congresswoman from which state?
Stand-up comedian and actor Richard Belzer died this week at 78. He played Detective John Munch for 23 years on what TV show franchise?
A woman was given a first-generation model of this device in 2007, and never opened it. It sold this week at auction for $63,000. What is it?
Before he won this week, how many times had NASCAR driver Ricky Stenhouse Jr. taken home the Daytona 500 championship title?
Carnival season closed this week in fantastic fashion with colorful parades, masks and of course loads of beads. Mardi Gras is French for what?
A 4ft-long alligator captured in Brooklyn’s Prospect Park has been nicknamed what?
Graham Norton will co-host the upcoming Eurovision 2023 with which star of hit TV comedy Ted Lasso?
A new study suggests that which rodents may hold the key to reversing the human menopause?
A survey of funeral directors reportedly found that bizarre final requests included a British man asking his family to eat what following his death?
Netflix adaptation All Quiet on the Western Front is being tipped for Oscars glory after winning how many Baftas?
Environment Secretary Therese Coffey faced ridicule for suggesting that Brits eat which seasonal vegetable amid food shortages?
Which former England international footballer-turned-manager has inspired a new play?
Books by which children’s author are being revised to make them more “palatable” to modern readers?
Support for SNP leadership front-runner Kate Forbes collapsed after she said what?
choices: She would have have voted against same-sex marriage
She doesn’t think Scottish independence is likely
he opposes free meals for primary school children

qa_2023.question_sentence: What is the “germiest” place in the kitchen, according to a new study?
